story:
THE NEXT GENERATION IN SOUND FREQUENCY DEVICES IS NOW AVAILABLE FOR HOME USE

The UrielTones Home Unit is the biggest newest wave in an ocean of sound frequency devices.    Come surf the wave with us.

HARMONIZE YOUR BODY, FINE-TUNE YOUR MIND

With this easy-to-use patented home device, anyone can experience a new level of calmness, peace, and rest—all through the safe, natural healing power of sound frequencies. But how? Our unique human-generated tones recalibrate the electromagnetic biofield and deeply relax your mind and body. The results are greater clarity, focus, and energy so you can live your best life. Both children and adults benefit from this extraordinary, safe and effective technology.

Reclaim your happy healthy place!

The UrielTones system works through a unique combination of listening to the right sound frequency while receiving this same frequency through pads placed at the right meridians throughout the body. It’s this blend that recalibrates and rejuvenates the body. The end result? Better sleep, less stress and a sharp mind.

URIELTONES ARE SPECIFICALLY DESIGNED TO CREATE A BALANCED BODY AND MIND IN THE MIDST OF A TECH-HEAVY WORLD

UrielTones can deliver you from tech burn-out

Let's be real. Living a sleepless, stress-filled chaotic lifestyle is not any fun. And it is not normal. So many have forgotten what it actually feels like to have our brains and bodies operate as intended.

We all want to feel healthy, happy, well-rested, and energized. We want our kids to be grounded and peaceful. We want to be able to continue to use our beloved tech devices without having to pay the price of a foggy mind and depleted energy.

Wake up relaxed and rested with UrielTones

With UrielTones and the healing power of human sound, a more peaceful life experience is within reach. UrielTones is a life-changing sound frequency experience utilizing the healing power of the human voice to relax the mind and to recalibrate the body to its healthy natural state, reducing the need for pricey doctor's visits and medication.

We are so confident that UrielTones will have dramatic results for you and your family, we are offering a 30 day full refund (see below).

Hear what others have to say in the video below and read more testimonials here  https://urielsound.com/testimonials/

What Is UrielTones? 

UrielTones is a patented device from Uriel Sound Corp. being successfully used by health care providers, wellness centers, and clinics across the US, Canada, and Europe. The UrielTones Home Unit is made up of the unit base, 4 pads that are attached to the ankles and wrists, 1 small/medium pad cover set, 1 medium/large pad cover set, and a pair of earbuds.

HOW URIELTONES WORK

UrielTones are experienced through listening (headphones) and through small pads on the body. Each of the 4 VitalTone pads consists of a speaker and a high grade lab grown crystal. The UrielTones programs consist of proprietary modulated human toning that is fed through the headphones so that it affects brainwave patterning. These tones also pass through the pads placed on the body. This impacts the entire neurological and physiological systems.

As the tones pass through the pads, the patented modulation pattern for each tone creates a unique oscillation in the crystal, generating a correspondingly unique frequency that can be felt deep inside the body. This counteracts disrupted conditions in the body and brain by creating a healthy restorative resonance that balances the autonomic nervous system. UrielTones leave you with an overall feeling of well-being and calmness. A majority of people fall asleep the first time they run. It grounds you and clears your mind and can put you into a deep meditative state.

Kids can sleep like a baby and wake up feeling like superman

The UrielTones Home Unit comes pre-programmed with 4 specific sets of tones—2 deep calm/sleep/stress programs and 2 mental clarity and balance programs—that can help anyone reach a deep level of relaxation, experience significantly improved sleep patterns, and achieve a higher state of mental clarity. For the large majority of people, this happens the first time they run on UrielTones. It is also equipped with a USB port to use in downloading additional tone programs that will be available in the future from the UrielTones website.

To read a more in-depth explanation of the science behind UrielTones, click here https://urielsound.com/the-science/

URIELTONES ARE UNIQUE

Human generated sound is the most powerful and effective carrier of frequency when compared to tones or rain and ocean wave sounds that are electronically or digitally produced. Human toning effects us more deeply than frequencies/tones created through the use of musical instruments, singing bowls, tuning forks, etc. This is because the body will more readily entrain with the human voice, as it is organic to us.

The human voice can elicit not only a physiological response but often a powerful, transcendent, and transformative emotional one as well.

Sound is a more efficient and effective way to deliver frequency into the body when compared to light. Our bodies are 60% to 75% water. Sound is able to penetrate more deeply and travel for much longer distances in a liquid medium than light waves that quickly dissipate. To read more about why UrielTones are so unique, click here.

URIELTONES COUNTERACT THE HARMFUL EFFECTS OF TOXIC EMFs

There are over five thousand scientific papers and peer reviewed studies on the health dangers of electromagnetic (EMF) fields such as WiFi and cell phone transmissions. These toxic EMFs are creating nervous system and sleep issues for a majority of the Western world. UrielTones can directly counter the effects of those disruptive fields by recalibrating the body and brain to their healthy resonant frequencies. Those who are electro-hypersensitive have received great relief from symptoms using UrielTones.

Product Development 

The UrielTones commercial unit has been in use with significant results for several years. We developed the UrielTones Home Unit in answer to the increasing demands from our commercial users who wish to have the same powerful UrielTones experience in the comfort of their own home whenever they please.

A team member slipping into the blissed out zone - One of the many perks of product testing at UrielTones.

Limited Availability

Because of the long lead-time on materials for the UrielTones Home Unit, we may only be manufacturing as many units as are claimed in this IndieGoGo campaign for delivery in February 2017. Additional units may not be available for purchase until mid to late 2017. Be an early adopter and bring the health benefits of UrielTones home to you and your family today!

Contraindications 

If you have or experience any of the following, please do not use the UrielTones Home Unit: pacemaker or any implanted electrical device, epilepsy, severe autistic spectrum disorder, severe atrial fibrillation, traumatic brain injury within the last six months. Not recommended for children under the age of two.

Money Back Guarantee

We at UrielTones are so confident in the results you can experience from this technology that we are offering a 30 day, money back guarantee for those of you that purchase the Home Unit on IndieGoGo. We will send confirmation of this once the project has completed, as well as with your product when it arrives on your doorstep. Please note that this does not apply to the sound sampler pack reward level. 

Risks and challenges

Although we have gone to extreme measures to ensure that delivery of the units will happen as we predict, there is always the possibility of something getting delayed (sound sampler pack will be delivered November to December 2016). We have multiple pieces that make up the device and they are coming from different locations, which may result in a few delays, but we do not foresee that being a problem.

story:
We worked closely with US Youth Futsal to develop the new Senda USHUAIA PRO futsal shoe. Here is what their coaches had to say about the shoe when they had a chance to test it in Buenos Aires.

 

 
 
 
 
 

     We took samples of the USHUAIA PRO shoe to our native Argentina, home of the reigning Futsal World Cup Champions, to test it with local professional players. After hundreds of rigorous training sessions on all types of surfaces, the results were unanimous: the USHUAIA PRO is unlike any futsal shoe in the world.

 
 


 




 

 

 xa
 


 


 

     We enlisted the best futsal shoe designers, players, and coaches in the world to create the most technical and comfortable futsal shoe ever. We selected best-in-class materials for each part of the shoe, from the rubber gum sole to the leather upper, so it can be used at the highest level of play. Below are the design sketches we used to create our initial testing samples.


 

     Senda is defined by its commitment to Fair Trade. Since 2010, Senda has been committed to making Fair Trade Certified Futsal balls to ensure better livelihoods and safe working conditions for workers, as well as no child labor. We identified a manufacturer that has been making premium quality shoes since 1991 and shares our commitment to workers’ well-being. As we grow into the shoe market we aim to secure fair trade certification for our partners, to proudly show this certification across our new line of products.


Risks and challenges

For the past months, the Senda team has been working tirelessly on all the design, production, and logistics aspects needed to launch the USHUAIA PRO Futsal Shoe. We have a very close relationship with our manufacturing partners, have spent weeks on the ground working on every detail of the shoe, and we also have a team supervising every detail related to production. We understand and acknowledge that no project comes without risk and challenges. Despite our planning, there are circumstances that may be out of our control. If we are met with these, we promise to communicate with full transparency to you. Global shipping can be complex and expensive, and that is why early on we decided to bring experts to take care of that. But even the experts aren't immune to weather, port congestion, and other uncontrollable factors. We promise to keep you informed when the USHUAIA PRO ships to you, and to post updates related to production and shipping progress once the campaign ends

story:
WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU...

Accept the challenge of assiting Raimana Van Bastolaer and his Team in the 2013 Olamau Race.

We need a new canoe to compete in the 2013 Olamau Race, against the strongest and the toughest. We are lucky to be embraced by spirit of Tahitian friendship from the Raimana World family near and far.  

Our incredible support team in Hawaii has donated accomodations on couches and floors across the Big Island. We are so thankful. But to make this adventure possible, we need your help to finish the new canoe that allows us to compete at the highest level, and fight the ocean and the clock alongside the world's best watermen.  

Funds raised go directly to building the boat and airfare for the team and their support crews. Tahitian friendship

Want More Shirts and Hats?

When you donate to the Fund Team Raimana World campaign you can select one "Perk" for your donation. If you would like to purchase multiple shirts & hats visit www.raimanaworld.com and click on "Store" to place an online order, or email amanda@wellhelloblackbird.com for large quantity orders. 

Other Ways You Can Help.

While we can't get to the race without the funds we need to finish our canoe, if you can't donate, there are still other ways to get involved and support the team.

  • Visit www.raimanaworld.com, check out our community and the STORE link - you can purchase Raimana World shirts and hats and 100% of the proceeds go to support Team Raimana World in the 2013 Olamau Race. 
  • Become a Raimana World Facebook fan at www.facebook.com/raimanaworld
  • Become a Olamau Race Facebook fan
  • Follow Raimana on Instagram at www.instagram.com/raimanaworld
  • SHARE our Indiegogo campaign with all of your friends!

 

Thank you.

story:
Hi Everyone!


Mark & I created this page to help raise funds for Nikki Marie. She's been in the hospital for over four weeks now and the medical bills are starting to roll in. Surgeries, medicine, daily care--it all adds up.
Her family needs our help! 

Any funds we raise will help with anything related to her getting healthier and continue on this road to recovery. 

Thank you for your help!

-Maricel & Mark

story: Please help me for I am fighting breast cancer. I am a single mother with 7 kids. I do not have a lot of money to make a fancy video. But I do have heart and God. And I do have kindness and mercy of strangers like you all to help me and back me up in my battle for life. I need to be there for my kids and myself and more importantly the Lord. I am a church goer I go to church all the time every Sunday and I pray everyday hoping kind people can help me and when that happens it was because of the Lord and you people. I do not have much time I just need enough to get by with when it comes to these medical bills. All I can say and give back is thank you and a prayer. Thank You God Bless.

story:
About Capoeira Fitness Academy

Capoeira Fitness Academy is a new unique facility opening in Apple Valley MN with a focus on the Brazilian martial art of Capoeira. We will also be offering additional programs in areas of martial arts, music, and fitness. 

We have been teaching and training this incredible art to children and adults for years, and with your generous contributions, we will finally have a place to call home. This facility will allow us to grow and do more for more people than ever before. Capoeira is unlike any other martial art in that it provides a healthy community environment for everyone to come together in friendship, encouraging personal growth physically and mentally. Students learn respect for others as well as self respect and respect of challenges.

Capoeira is a Martial Art, so students learn techniques to defend themselves,  improve fitness at ANY level, and train to achieve their personal goals. But there is so much more to it. In capoeira classes, students develop physically, emotionally, and mentally as they train Capoeira's challenging movements, learn to play  traditional instruments, sing music in Portuguese, and apply their training in an  exciting  improvised "game" that helps students develop their personal strength,  response time, creativity, courage, and self-expression. 

Thank you for your support! This will be so awesome! We hope that you join us as a contributor to our campaign or even a future student as well!

Our Goal

Our plan is to create one of the best training facilities in the country, but also introduce Capoeira to so many who are not familiar. Our goal is to become a main cornerstone of the community.

We want to build a place where students can learn new things everyday and can train what they've learned all day long if they choose..a place where anyone can benefit from the classes we offer and have a great time every time they walk through the door.

For their dedication to Capoeira and the people involved, our group of students deserve a great facility that can maximize their potential. Capoeira Fitness Academy will offer classes and open training hours during the day and evening hours, six days a week. This location also gives us the opportunity to offer additional programs aside from Capoeira.

    What we will use the money for

    The money we receive from this campaign will be used to install new flooring and mirrors, finish some final touches in the construction phase, purchase training equipment and instruments, and improve the overall appearance of the Academy and students. More specifically...

    • Install new flooring
    • Mirrors to cover the front of classroom
    • A new attractive outdoor sign
    • Training equipment (pads, mats, etc)
    • New Capoeira instruments to replace our few old busted up ones
    • Improvements to our lobby area (chairs, tables, decor)
    • Help with some of our start up marketing costs
    • New custom student uniforms
    If we do not reach the full amount for this campaign, we will use the donated funds we do get to do as much of this as we can. We will simply start with the most important projects and do as much as possible.

      Why should you donate?

      With your contributions, you are helping to create a place for children and adults better their lives for years to come. Not only will you be helping one local community, but also a much broader Capoeira community that spans across the midwest and people around the country.

      In addition to daily classes, this academy opening, will allow us to bring future special events here. It will help our group host larger events than ever before, with more guest teachers from all over the world coming to share their wealth of knowledge. These events are filled with seminars, presentations, and promotions. So by donating to our cause, we can give a lot back to so many!

      Also we are offering some amazing perks for donating! Be sure to check those out! Some of them can even save you a bunch of money if you are thinking of taking classes at Capoeira Fitness! If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help us out! Thank you so much for your donations! Every dollar counts.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

        • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
        • Help us share our campaign around the internet! The more you share, the better the chance of us reaching our goal!

story:
Our Mission

We are two sisters (Ruth, 26, and Deb, 21) who are together going on our first trip to the coastal towns of Santa Marta and Barranquilla in Colombia, South America. Our small team of 12 will be traveling and working for 10 days in a few different places, including in a children's home in Santa Marta, with a tribe in the mountains, in a community center in Barranquilla, and wherever else we are needed. Accompanying us are a few Spanish speakers and medical professionals (Deb, who is finishing up pre-med at Rutgers, being one of them). We are bringing purchased and donated medical supplies, construction materials, art supplies, and our expertise and labor to each place. We still need to raise more funds for our supplies and for travel expenses. Your support is important to us, because we are completely self-funded! 

Our flights will depart from Philadelphia on August 9th. Deb returns on August 21st with the team, and I return on August 31st after further solo explorations of the region. 

 

About Us

I, Ruth, have lived abroad and have traveled in the Middle East, North Africa, Central America, and Europe. I have worked closely with international students and have had work roles supporting people going out on medical missions. I am a working professional now but find ways to consistently be involved in community work. Deb has a passion for the community and has worked extensively in our immediate communities in Camden and in West Chester, and has in the past traveled to Honduras to volunteer her time and labor. She wishes to be involved in medical missions in the future, and this would be her first trip using her medical skills. Our dad nearly devoted his life to working as a doctor in Senegal when I was a baby, and his passion seems to have rubbed off on us :)

All 12 of us are members of Tenth Presbyterian Church in Philadelphia. All of us have done volunteer work before, are involved in our communities now, and see it as something we want to be involved in for the rest of our lives. Some of us have been to these specific towns in Colombia before and have already built connections with the children and staff there. Our team will be working with two churches in the area, both of which are deeply involved in their communities and both of which are led by the brothers of our Colombian friend Enrique, who, with his wife, devoted his life to working in the Philadelphia community. Our leader on this trip, Bruce, is from South America. All of our leaders are natives to the area, so understand the needs there and the challenges we will face. Please see the links at the end of this petition to explore the websites of the Colombia missions.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Deb and I have to raise $1,800 each, for our flight, travel expenses, medical supplies, and construction supplies. We have both raised $900 each. We need your help to raise the additional funds. Any additional funds we will raise will go to buying more supplies and to help the community.

We will be making a blog, which we will update with journals and photos whenever we have a chance. You will receive a link to this blog with any monetary donation. We will also be bringing back copies of thank-you drawings from our young friends at the children's home, and we plan to send postcards and buy small gifts for our bigger supporters. Anyone who gives $20 or more will receive a mention on our blog (this will include your name and/or a link to your organization). We want you, our supporters, to feel a personal connection to the mission which you are supporting.

 

The Impact

Our trip will have a significant impact on the communities we are serving, especially since a team goes down there every year and we now have direct connections to the communities and therefore a knowledge of what they really need. We will be supplying much-needed medical care to a few different communities. Our main work will be in an orphanage in Santa Marta. We will be bringing our medical clinic to them and will be supplying them with materials and labor to build, amongst other things, their first bathroom. The peoples of Colombia rarely have access to any medicine whatsoever, mainly because of poverty, so our team's yearly visits a valuable asset to the community. 

 

If You Don't have $$

Please spread the word about our cause! We think it's a worthy one and we need your help and your support. Indiegogo is a great website that has plenty of tools to help you spread the message.

If you wish to donate $ to our trip after August 15 but before September 1, you may send a check in my name to Tenth Church at 1701 Delancey Street, Philadelphia, PA 19103. Please let me know if you plan to do this. You may also PayPal me directly at rkiehlmeier@gmail.com.

 

Websites / More Info

Journal entry and photos from a volunteer at the children's home in Santa Marta.

See our team's YouTube video... We collected tons of donations and filled 12 bins full of medical supplies, clothing, art supplies, and even an ice cream maker for the children's home! (Album link) (Slideshow)

Check out this link to our Picasa album from the team's 2011 trip to the same area.

In Santa Marta, Colombia, Pastor Jaime Leal runs the orphanage / children's home "Hogar la Providencia" and the church "Iglesia la Puerta." In Barranquilla, Colombia, Pastor Rafael Leal runs the community center "Los Olivos" and the church "Iglesia la Roca. Tenth Presbyterian Church, of which we are all members, is involved in a number of community services in the local and global community. Tenth is located at 17th and Spruce in Center City, Philadelphia. I work part-time in their international fellowship, organizing events and outings.

story:
Short Summary

I am a Family Medicine resident at the Univerisity of Cincinnati/The Christ Hospital. My residency program has a special focus in global health and they allow us to participate in global health each year. For the past 2 Aprils I have been to rural Honduras to work at our clinic there. It was a great opportunity to learn how to care for patients in country with limited resources. This February, I have the opportunity to go to Haiti to work with at a hospital in La Valle de Jacmel named Hospital St. Joseph. They have a partnership with Tulane University in New Orleans under an organization named Association Haitienne de Developpement Humain, Inc (AHDH). This organization visits Haiti 3-4 times per year and perform hernia surgeries, eye surgeries, delivery of babies, care to adults and children for chronic and acute illnesses. They also provide support to the local medical team that is working with Haitian patients year round.

What We Need & What You Get

I would like to buy as many boxes of medicine as possible for $50 each. Ideally 4 boxes for $200. They have also requested other medicines for scabies and ringworm treatment for the children so I would use an additional $100 for this purpose.

In addition they need help to support the local health professionals who will be helping us in the hospital and clinics. They need $350 for an anesthesia nurse, $250 for a scrub nurse, and $500 for the local physician who works in the clinic year round. They also have a lunch program for the patients who cannot afford to buy food that costs $100. If I raise any additionaly money I will use it for these purposes.

What you get from me is a person going to help a community with the unique skill set of family medicine training so I am able to help with surgeries, perform delivery of babies, treat adults and children for medical problems. I am the only family medicine person that is going to Haiti this February.

The Impact

This project is important because Haiti is one of the poorest nations in the world. Many of the persons there do not have access to clean water or food, and healthcare is considered a luxury. The AHDH is a great organization because they have committed to working with one community to uplift this community for over 20 years with access to healthcare and it does not stop there. They also have clean water and agriculture sustainability projects. They also work to educate the youth and adults so that they are building a Haitian medical force to help them to become independent in the future.

I have witnessed this impact firsthand through my work in Honduras. The work that my residency has been involved with through Shoulder to Shoulder over the past 20 years has helped to strengthen a community through access to healthcare and education. This community gets stronger each day and has so much potential for the future and knows what kinds of medical innovations that may come from these communities in the future that could change so many other lives.

You can obtain more information about their impact and view pictures at the website of AHDH: www.haitiahdh.org

Other Ways You Can Help

Pray for the safe return of our team members to their families and for the people of Haiti.

Tell a friend who can help with donations!

If you cannot help in such short notice feel free to donate at their website at any later time: www.haitiahdh.org

story:
Dr. Bronner’s Magic Soaps is raising $25,000 to provide life-saving mosquito nets for thousands of families to fight the spread of malaria in the region surrounding Asuom, Ghana.

We will proudly match each dollar raised.

--

  • Update:

    Thanks to everyone who has helped us reach our goal with 19 days left in the campaign! The first $25,000 raised combined with matching funds from Dr. Bronner's will allow us to provide 5,000 bednets for families in Eastern Ghana.

  • Help us Reach $45K!

    $25K = Provided 5,000 bednets (Done!)

    $45K = Builds a maternity ward at the local hospital

    Additional contributions to this campaign will allow us to purchase even more bednets, as well as to start raising funds for our next project to help the local hospital in Asuom to build a new maternity ward and increase its capacity to provide pre-natal care and other women's health services.

The Bronner family has been making soap for 5 generations. The goal of this generation is to carry on the social and environmental ideals of our grandfather, Dr. Bronner. One of the ways we do this is by doing right by the farmers and workers who produce the raw materials in our soaps, which includes supporting development projects in their communities.

We invite you to be a part of an important initiative related to our palm oil project in Asuom, Ghana. Great work has been done there so far. As explained in the video above, Fair Trade funds have provided four deep water wells, living quarters for nurses at a local hospital and school supplies for children.

Our partners in Ghana have singled out malaria prevention as a top priority for their next community project and we need your help to make it a success. We are inviting you to help and support a project that will make a substantial improvement in quality of life for thousands of families in Ghana.

Malaria is spread by a single mosquito bite and causes extensive pain and suffering and prevents people from earning a living. In the district surrounding Asuom, an estimated 40% of the population is infected with malaria each year and a quarter of cases affect children under the age of 5.

It doesn’t have to be this way. Bed nets (also called mosquito nets) offer a simple and cost-effective solution. They create a protective barrier against often-deadly mosquito bites and allow families to sleep safely through the night. And they work: bed nets are known to reduce malaria transmissions by 90% in areas with high net coverage.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $25,000. Dr. Bronner's will match each dollar raised, with the goal of reaching a total of at least $50,000 to provide 5,000 bed nets for families in the communities where our palm oil is produced.

We are asking you to make a donation to support this important project.

Perks and Need to Know Info:

  • Every $10 donated will allow us to purchase and distribute a bed net for a family in need.
  • We have created a special bar of soap with a commemorative label as a thank you gift for your donation. Every donation of $10 or more gets this special bar of soap!
  • We are offering a range of other perks including a t-shirt, DVD, Fair Trade gift basket, dinner with our family, and even a trip to Ghana to visit our palm oil mill.
  • On top of all this - we will proudly match each dollar raised.

  • If you are considering making a donation for a friend or family member as a holiday gift, we expect to be able to deliver perks for all donations made by Dec. 10 before Christmas Eve.

  • Pictures of the perks are available under the gallery tab at the top of this campaign description.
  • Terms & conditions for the campaign and each of the perks can be found here.
  • Note: we can not send Perks overseas for this campaign. We will only send Perks within the 50 United States and the District of Columbia and Puerto Rico.
  • If you are having problems processing your donation through Paypal please see this Indiegogo help page for more information.

If we exceed our goal we will use the additional funds to support other critical healthcare initiatives in the region, including efforts to build a new maternity ward at the local hospital in Asuom.

Impact

This project is unique because it has sprouted from Dr. Bronner's direct relationship with the community in Asuom, Ghana that produces the palm oil used in our bar soaps. The project is being run by our friends and business partners at Serendipalm, our sister project in Asuom, who are working to identify and meet healthcare needs in their community.

We are also raising awareness of the importance of creating and supporting fair and sustainable supply chains based on respect, transparency and direct relationships. If you support this idea, please consider supporting this project. 

At Dr. Bronner's Magic Soaps, we think of ourselves as the fighting soap company. The over 30,000 words spread across all the soap labels are the result of Dr. Bronner's life work of searching every religion and philosophy for "Full Truths," which can be summed up in two beautiful sentences:

1. ”Constructive Capitalism is where you share the profit with the workers and the earth from which you made it!”

2. “We are all brothers and sisters and we should take care of each other and spaceship earth!”

For more information on Dr. Bronner’s and our Fair Trade work and other activism around the world, check out our website.

All donations to this project are being coordinated by Dr. Bronner's Family Foundation, a nonprofit organization.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help us spread the word!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! Post and share far and wide!
  • Make Fair Trade a part of your consumer ethos, by purchasing Fair Trade certified products.

Please join us and help us reach our goal. Thanks in advance for your support and please spread the word!

Ntontom dan n'aseda nie! – Thanks for the mosquito nets!

Sincerely,

David, Lisa, and Michael Bronner

On top of all this - we will proudly match each dollar raised.

If you are considering making a donation for a friend or family member as a holiday gift, we expect to be able to deliver perks for all donations made by Dec. 10 before Christmas Eve.


Pictures of the perks are available under the gallery tab at the top of this campaign description.

Terms & conditions for the campaign and each of the perks can be found here.

Note: we can not send Perks overseas for this campaign. We will only send Perks within the 50 United States and the District of Columbia and Puerto Rico.

If you are having problems processing your donation through Paypal please see this Indiegogo help page for more information.
If we exceed our goal we will use the additional funds to support other critical healthcare initiatives in the region, including efforts to build a new maternity ward at the local hospital in Asuom. 
Impact

This project is unique because it has sprouted from Dr. Bronner's direct relationship with the community in Asuom, Ghana that produces the palm oil used in our bar soaps. The project is being run by our friends and business partners at Serendipalm, our sister project in Asuom, who are working to identify and meet healthcare needs in their community.
We are also raising awareness of the importance of creating and supporting fair and sustainable supply chains based on respect, transparency and direct relationships. If you support this idea, please consider supporting this project. 

At Dr. Bronner's Magic Soaps, we think of ourselves as the fighting soap company. The over 30,000 words spread across all the soap labels are the result of Dr. Bronner's life work of searching every religion and philosophy for "Full Truths," which can be summed up in two beautiful sentences:
1. ”Constructive Capitalism is where you share the profit with the workers and the earth from which you made it!”
2. “We are all brothers and sisters and we should take care of each other and spaceship earth!”
For more information on Dr. Bronner’s and our Fair Trade work and other activism around the world, check out our website.
All donations to this project are being coordinated by Dr. Bronner's Family Foundation, a nonprofit organization.
Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word!

Use the Indiegogo share tools! Post and share far and wide!

Make Fair Trade a part of your consumer ethos, by purchasing Fair Trade certified products.
Please join us and help us reach our goal. Thanks in advance for your support and please spread the word!
Ntontom dan n'aseda nie! – Thanks for the mosquito nets!
Sincerely,
David, Lisa, and Michael Bronner

story:
About Me
Hi there! My name is Camille and I'm putting a call out to all you angels. I find myself at a profound crossroads in my life. This past year in particular has brought severe physical and emotional challenges including a serious illness and hospitalization; and currently the end of my 18 year relationship, which I've been deeply devoted to.

But as challenged as I have been through this past year, I am equally committed to making significant, positive changes in my life through recapturing my good health, returning to "Me", and finding my niche to make a meaningful contribution in the world.

Despite years of soul-searching and asking to be shown a Way, I've never discovered a "GPS" for locating a path to guide me to my life's purpose. To the contrary, I've set out on my own in numerous different directions, pursuing widely varied paths that I now feel took me off my natural course and, as a result, left me feeling lost.

My Intention
But now I've found an innovative and comprehensive program of self-discovery that resonates deeply with me. Through immersing myself in a mostly-structured, 10-week pilgrimage to Thailand and Bali, I will have access to that GPS, to a map that I believe leads to a life path more in harmony with my true nature.

This pilgrimage will provide me the opportunity to expand my global perspective while further opening my heart and mind. Through extensive volunteer work, study, and personal reflection it will deepen my relationship with my Self, local and global communities, other sentient beings, and our environment while expanding my understanding of physical, emotional, and spiritual health and healing.

It also will culminate in my being certified in the sacred healing art of Thai Yoga Massage, a unique and magical combination of deep stretching, rhythmic compression, gentle rocking, energy balancing and acupressure. Its relaxed pace and fluid movements are nurturing and profoundly relaxing, creating a safe space for individuals to let go while feeling supported. This letting go is essential for everyone, but particularly for people whose sense of place or belonging has been lost, damaged or violated.

So, despite the 'nay-saying' voices of logic that regularly fill my head with all the reasonable-sounding arguments as to why I cannot possibly take the time, spend the money, 'not work', and leave my home and family obligations to retreat inward and reconnect with "Me", I choose to take this "illogical" leap of faith, and follow my heart.

I am eager, once I set foot upon this path, to return home and share my newfound insights and skills with YOU. And to get there I need your support!

Where You Come In (or, It's Good to be Needed ;))
I have been blessed to be a source of help, support and encouragement for others in my life – and I am happy and grateful to do it! It's how I roll. ;) And now, as I ask the Universe how to make the dream of this pilgrimage a reality, I'm being told, "Camille, it's time to let others have the blessing of helping you; AND for you to learn to receive that blessing of support."

We are the channels through which the blessings of the Universe flow. They don't fall from the sky and land on our doorsteps. We offer them to each other, according to our compassion and ability.

I am very grateful to have in you that community of support! Thank you so much for visiting my campaign and volunteering your valuable time to read my story. Blessings. Namaste.

Your Contributions
In addition to my personal investment of $4,000, I calculate another $12,500 will be needed. Your generous contributions will provide:

Tuition and partial accommodations for the 10-week program:.....................$6,875

Round-trip travel to, from and within Thailand and Bali; expenses associated
with the independent study portions of the program, including additional
accommodations, meals, tuitions and fees:..................................................$3,125

Home to come back to (or "help towards 10 weeks maintaining bills, pet care
and home while not working and not bringing in income"):.............Additional $2,500

PERKS
If you'd like to e-mail me with a specific request, a specific item or 'souvenir' you'd like from Thailand or Bali, or if you'd like to ask me questions about my quest or send me good wishes, please feel free to do so. I'll be happy to pick up your souvenir as long as I can find it; answer your questions; or graciously receive your kind comments.

I'm also 'hell at organizing', so if you'd like some help getting through that clutter or reclaiming a closet, pantry or room, I'm eager to offer this service as well in exchange for your generous and kind support. Otherwise, some perks are suggested in the side bar.

If you'd like to offer your support but are unable at this time to make a monetary contribution, items that would be of good use and deeply appreciated are:

Large, hiker's backpack (to borrow?)
'Smart phone' (a used one you plan to replace with an iPhone 5? ;)) to keep in touch with 'home'
Digital camera to help record the experience
Spread the word: share my Indiegogo story with friends, family and colleagues. Thank you!

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

Testimonials (or, "I am so deeply humbled and grateful." }- )).

"I've known Camille for two decades. Her heart is open to every living thing, from plants and stray creatures to friends in need. She has helped me heal from sickness and trauma. She always seeks the peaceful and loving path."  -Jack E.

"Camille has given so much of herself to so many of us, it's important that we support her now when she needs our help." -Joe A.

"Camille has an 'empathic intelligence' that is the hallmark of a healer. Like many healers, her winding path has brought her to this perfect moment to apply her hard-won insights. She has persevered through many explorations of direction, supported others all the way, and has remained true to what seems to be her underlying imperative to serve. I hope this pilgrimage will become a reality for her. She deserves it – and those she will serve deserve her compassion and commitment. Go Camille!" -Mary F.

"Camille is loyal, caring, kind, funny and extremely sensitive to life and its lessons and treasures. I have seen Camille struggle over the years to find a place in this world that is fulfilling to her sensitive and philanthropic nature. When she told me about this program in Thailand and Bali, I knew she would not only learn the massage techniques, but would connect with the spiritual nature and reasons for doing this work. So much of her time and resources have been spent in helping others. She deserves this, and I personally would love to see her have this opportunity. I think this is a brilliant way for those of us who know and care about Camille to help her achieve this very special and very precious opportunity."
-Clenice V.

*Music on slide show: "Winter Wildflowers"©, by Jack Erdie

Team Members
Camille - Team Administrator

Jack - Chief Encouragement Officer

Heather - Consultant and Role Model Extraordinaire

story:
Skai Juice and her husband,True Asiatic started Paradise Wellness in 2009 when they moved from Baltimore, MD to Luquillo, Puerto Rico. They offer a one week wellness retreat that incorporates a raw food dietary program with an island eco-fitness tour. During the one, two or three week retreat, guests get to experience hiking, swimming, biking, horseback riding, kayaking, salsa dancing and more! Skai is the Chef and Host of the program and True is the tour guide. They also have Iris Mercado for Ashtanga Yoga, and Carla Rivera, the Massage Therapist. They host groups from 2 people up to 30 people.  The retreats are housed in beachfront or rainforest villas, interchangeably, depending on the group type.

Skai Juice, Vegan and Raw Food Chef and Nutritional Consultant, is most noted for creating and establishing the very first vegan cafe in the city of Baltimore, called the Yabba Pot, back in 2002.  Timing was everything and her cafe boomed, as she was feeding customers from the neighboring Charles Village community as well as followers who traveled in as far as Philadelphia and DC. She also catered a multitude of events from Poetry Jams, Festivals, and glamourous weddings. Skai has been featured in every major news media in the Baltimore area, including: The City Paper, Baltimore Magazine, The Baltimore Sun, The Baltimore Times, The Afro, the Baltimore Journal, and Vegetarian Resource Guide's Vegetarian Journal...to name a few.

Paradise Wellness (www.paradisewellness.net) is in a place where its needs a little financial love grease and some magical communal sponsorship. Paradise Wellness has been growing steadily and has worked her magic for the last few years.  Each and every retreat gets better than the last.  Skai and True need to generate some investment monies to fund a small marketing campaign. "We have researched what it takes to bust this business out into the forefront..and what it takes is a creative marketing campaign," says True.

Paradise Wellness has a mission to help people to achieve a healthy and abundant life. The concept is a now-revolutionary movement...with Raw Food being the number one healing remedy for people and the planet as a whole because it promotes farming and sustainibility. "Our goal is to be able to put our business in the front of as many people as possible, especially those who are challenged by issues related to the Standard American Dietary diseases: Diabetes, Cancer, Heart Disease, " says Skai. "Hopefully you can help!"

<><><><><><><><>

Our goal is to raise $12,000.  The money will be used to pay for a small advertising campaign, a colonic machine, and some retreat supplies. In addition, we plan to create a scholarship fund to assist those that want to attend a wellness retreat and are financially challenged.  Once these things are in place, we will be set on a sturdy foundation for all future retreats to come.

For a few dollars, you will be an investor in the creation of something that will serve the lives of others, and possibly yourself too – we would love to have you with us!  Help us to help you (and others) heal the world!

Why an IndieGoGo crowd funding campaign?

Crowd funding has become one of the most popular tools to manifest all kinds of creative dreams. Really it feels like one big, beautiful act of community sharing where everybody wins and people are supported in shining even more in the world. 

We are asking for your support in meeting our goal (and beyond!) and in helping spread the word to create a big BUZZ about Paradise Wellness. We were recently visited by an EBONY MAGAZINE writer and are awaiting that article to be released to help with this Buzz!

How you can help us reach our goal...  

Help us build this dream by donating (if you can) as well as commenting, liking, and sharing all over social media and your email lists. It is super easy...just use the IndieGoGo share tools right here!  This helps our campaign build momentum.

In spirit of the new gifting/sharing economy paradigm, we have some amazing gratitude rewards for your generous support. You can earn Chef Skai's newest eBook, Mp3 downloads, private coaching programs, and more.  If you really want to donate to our campaign but would prefer to gift the perk on to someone else that is an option too (they would make great gifts).

So that is how it works!

We know that together we can reach our goal and hopefully even surpass it. With the power of the people and social media combined, we all have the ability to create a happier, healthier, more juicy world for us all!

We are forever grateful for this amazing journey.....come and see us someday at Paradise Wellness!

Peace and Greens,

Skai and True

www.paradisewellness.net

www.chefskaicreates.com

www.paradisewellness.wordpress.com

story:
The Backjack is a light weight portable back relief system that provides relief for all types and severity of back issues. 

What makes the Backjack so innovative is its ease of use and mobility.  With a custom sized rib band the Backjack will fit almost every body type, tall, short, thin or round.

Backjack CAD Drawing (above)

 

The Backjack prototype shown in a car seat (above)

 

Who is the Backjack designed for?

The Backjack is designed to help those with severe back pain or those who need occasional relief.

When severe pain occurs, use the Backjack several times throughout the day to ease the area of irritation and help you rest.

Backjack being used at work (above)

 

When minor discomfort occurs after work or from participation in a sporting event, the Backjack can be used to help provide relief from the constant exertion of the day.

Relieves stiffness after golfing or other physical activity (above)

 

In fact, when used just 10 minutes each day, the Backjack becomes a preventative maintenance treatment that helps individuals continue their active lifestyle.  By reducing or eliminating pain the Backjack helps you function as a normal well rested person.

Easy to use through out the day (above) 

 

Is the Backjack easy to use?

The true genius of this item is captured within its ease of use and mobility. When compared to other methods of treatments involving special tables, pullies, levers and heavy equipment, it is easy to see why the Backjack is a better alternative.

The Backjack has one-step folding, quick connect buckles and adjustable straps.

One step folding lets the Backjack travel with you, it even fits inside the average suitcase (above)

 

Where can the Backjack be used?

This unit can be placed on a chair at home, in the office, on an airplane or in a car.  Set up and begin to feel the relief in a few short minutes.

 

On your favorite chair at home (above)

 

Use in the car (above) 

 

One step folding and quick release buckles easily fasten to car seats (above)

 

Fastens to executive chair easily (above)

 

 Fasten to office chair (above)

 

Can adapt to most chairs (above)

 

How does it help relieve pain?

The Backjack uses a unique combination of an upper torso lift, ancillary armrests and an adaptive lumbar support (memory foam) to help the body achieve natural relief from a variety of back discomforts by decompressing the spine, supporting the back, and creating correct posture. 

The Backjack relieves pressure from the lower back by lifting and holding the upper body in place. Gravity then seperates the lumbar vertebrate and eases discomfort. Although results do vary, pain relief is almost immediate for most users.

 

The Rib Band lifts the body while the Velcro holds it in place to relieve the pressure from the lower/mid back (above)

 

Ancillary Arm Rest help support the upper body to relieve pressure from lower back (above)

 

Adjustable Lumber Support can help isolate the pain area (above)

 

What are the Rib Band sizes? 

Small - measures 20in-33in / 50cm-76cm

Medium - measures 35in-48in / 88cm-114cm

Large - measures 50in-60in / 127cm-152cm

(emails will be sent to gather size information)

 

Is there a weight limit that the Backjack can support? 

Yes, 325lbs is the maximum load capacity for the Backjack.

 

What if I dont want to use all three components?

The Backjack can be used in full or in part by using individual components to help isolate the area where relief is needed.  It can easily adjust to meet each individual's needs. 

 

no rib band (above)

 

remove the lumber support (above)

 

 

Just Arm Rest (above)

 

When you are finished using the Backjack, simply pull the rib band and walk away. The Backjack will be ready and waiting for its next use.

ready to go

 

 

We have finalized our design, field tested our product and built a successful prototype.  We just need to complete the tooling to finish this product. With your support, we can get this project launched.

Feel free to email any questions to:  smack@duracart.com

Please Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/in8health

Thank You.

Stacey W Mack

 

Although we have sought advice from medical professionals we do not hold degrees in this field and would always recommend seeking professional treatment for severe back injuries.  Feel free to share the Backjack with your medical professional, as we have had several providers endorse this product.

Large - measures 50in-60in / 127cm-152cm
(emails will be sent to gather size information)
 
Is there a weight limit that the Backjack can support? 
Yes, 325lbs is the maximum load capacity for the Backjack.
 
What if I dont want to use all three components?
The Backjack can be used in full or in part by using individual components to help isolate the area where relief is needed.  It can easily adjust to meet each individual's needs. 
 
no rib band (above)
 

remove the lumber support (above)
 
 
Just Arm Rest (above)
 
When you are finished using the Backjack, simply pull the rib band and walk away. The Backjack will be ready and waiting for its next use.

ready to go
 
 
We have finalized our design, field tested our product and built a successful prototype.  We just need to complete the tooling to finish this product. With your support, we can get this project launched.
Feel free to email any questions to:  smack@duracart.com
Please Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/in8health
Thank You.
Stacey W Mack
 
Although we have sought advice from medical professionals we do not hold degrees in this field and would always recommend seeking professional treatment for severe back injuries.  Feel free to share the Backjack with your medical professional, as we have had several providers endorse this product.

story:
Citizen Direct Testing of Toxins in Environment

Health Canada or Environment Canada has not done mass test on how much of Monsanto's Roundup has gotten into human body fluids, nor has it set up labs that can do this test:

  • Federal Govt does not respond to our letters (http://www.tonu.org/2014/05/29/atamanenko/).
  • In Canada, only water and soil can now be tested, for closer to 300 dollars a test - quite out of reach of citizens.
  • No Canadian lab is able to test if people have glyphosate in themselves, through samples of blood, urine or breast milk from nursing mothers.
  • Labs in the US were testing for glyphosate at costs above $100 for human body fluids.
  • We are looking for labs that may agree to batch processing at a reasonable cost.
  • There are some financially challenged that cannot afford that money, and are eating unhealthy food suspected laced with Glyphosate, which is practically in every food that is not organic.
  • This funding is to help them to test their urine and breast milk for nursing mothers.
  • Walmart, Safeway and other food stores do not respond when we asked about testing their food to check if Glyphosate is present in their food. So this funding is to test their random sample of food.

What we plan to do and what you will see

We intend to pay ourselves, those that can afford, for testing our own urine, drinking water and food, and then use the funds here to test a vast number of the poorer people that cannot afford to eat Organic, as well as from common food sources such as what is sold in food stores :

  • Bulk test packages using 96T kits, one could use 40 samples duplicate tested in each batch. Using the magnetic particle test 120T kit, one could get up to 50 samples duplicate tested. These batch processing schemes bring the cost down to around US$ 1400 plus transportation charge to send 40 or 50 samples, by currier service. So with $6000 we hope to do at least three or four batches of poor people, covering almost 200 samples, involving perhaps 100 people and a hundred more of food samples, soil, water etc.
  • Some US labs are now seriously involved in trying to cater to our need. Some Canadian labs are also looking in on joining up.
  • We intend to place the results on the web, without individuals identity, to see where Canada stands with regard to intrusion of Glyphosate into regions, into different age groups, gender, eating style etc!
  • The funds will be used to make bulk payment to labs in the US that are able and willing to do these tests economically, while we continue to search for a lab, somewhere in Canada that can do similar tests, hopefully in comparable costing, though we have not located even one in Canada so far.

The Impact

The final results, hopefully coming in from all over Canada, totalling hundreds and hundreds of tests, perhaps even thousands, makes it a broad range analysis and will hopefully provide a more detailed picture of how much of the dangerous pesticide has gotten into us:

  • As far as we know, no other place in the planet has done this kind of large scale test before, either by Government or by the people, although Moms Across America did conduct a limited test of under a hundred samples, which already proved presence of Glyphosate even in the breast milk of some nursing mothers. A lot of folks are waiting to see how the results turn out for Canada.
  • We have not used Indigogo before, though we have used volunteer funding and are using it for a cross Canada talking tour on Food Security by retired genetic engineer Dr. Thierry Vrain, and myself (https://www.facebook.com/pages/GE-Foods-Tour/39...)
  • People are encouraged to write to me for more details - tony.mitra@gmail.com.

Joining the movement

If you are interested to join the movement as a volunteer, or a regional coordinator, or a candidate for testing yourself, or know someone that shoudl be tested, do contact us, especially where

  • You are sick from damaged gut bacteria, or through Crohn's, Celiac, leaky gut, autism, bowl disfunction, obesity or depression.
  • Once the data starts coming in, we intend to turn the testing into a political movement, to force the health care division of the Government to confront these issues instead of continue to accept ever increasing quantities of toxicity in our food, our land, our water and in ourselves.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Volunteer for us - to round up more people that can pay for their own tests.
  • People you might know that might like to contribute to the cause, no matter how small the amount!

Contributor list - Thank you for helping

Here is the list. Of course folks have the option not to be seen and those anonymous donors are not listed here.

  • $10 - Karin Nelson, Janice Andrews, S J WELSH
  • $15 - Sandra Rennick
  • $25 - Sarah G Hargreaves, Hilary M. Aulando, Sarah Baird, Joanna Wedge,  Sarah S. Mason, Reggie Hilliard, Alex Crook, Heather Clisby, Catherine S Colvin.
  • $50 - Marie-Claude Poisson, David V Green, Wally Martin, Alex Atamanenko.
  • $100 - Tony Mitra, Melissa Williams, Kathleen W Bordeleau, S J LEWIS, Gloria Dixon, Jenny White, Barbara Dempster, Leena Chatterjee.
  • $200 - Brandie Harrop.
  • $1,000 - Lynn Nichols

  • Other Contributor - Heather Quick.

story:
Hello, my name is Melissa and I am a full time Masters student Studying Ethics in New York City. I have worked for several non-profit organizations through my education and have traveled to Ecuador to build houses for those in need. My life has been truly blessed and now I have found a new way to help others.

 A few years ago, I began practicing yoga and discovered the ways in which this practice can change someone's life. I know it personally has changed mine. I have discovered true joy in life through this practice and I have seen the ways in which yoga can brighten someone’s spirit.

It has become a dream of mine to become a certified yoga instructor but unfortunately my education has drained all of my funds.

There is a teacher training this summer at Yoga to the People in New York City and I would be honored to participate. I plan on using my certification to host free classes around the city, to show others how they can find inner peace through the self-love promoted throughout yogic practice. There are several churches in my neighborhood that have agreed to provide the space for community classes as long as they have someone who can provide instruction. Most of the people who attend these classes are homeless or unable to pay for healthy activities such as yoga. With your help I can become a certified yoga instructor and I can spend my time during the week helping others in need through the benefits of this practice.

The training costs $2,800. It is a 10-week intensive yoga certification. Once certified, I will be certified for life.  If I am not able to get the required funds by the first certification cycle, I will continue to work hard in order to make the next round of teacher training.

Living in New York City I am surrounded by the homeless and the impoverished. These people are ignored by almost everyone else in this city because most people don’t realize that we are one mistake away from being where they are.

Yoga is inherently inspirational. It is all about the connections we can make within ourselves and with the rest of humanity. Yoga gives me a reason to wake up in the morning. It can do the same for the people I hope to teach one day. I want to show these people that we have not forgotten about them, that we value them as individuals who can contribute to society, and that we all deserve love. Yoga is a practice of learning to love one’s self.

Even if you cannot contribute you can still help by spreading the word on my campaign. There is a way of sharing my campaign with your friends.

This would be the greatest gift I have ever received and I am truly humbled by the generosity and kindness we are capable of showing to one another.

Please help me to help others.

Namaste

story:
One of the fastest growing concerns of the World Health Organization and the US Environmental Protection Agency is the increasing amount of bacteriafound in both surface and ground water supplies creating a major source of sickness and disease worldwide.  

In most cases the source of contamination is linked directly to septic waste disposal systems.  The reality is that 90% of the time septic failure is due to malfunctions of leach fields that are expected to do the bulk of the sewage processing in conventional systems.  This monumental problem of critical proportions is best summarized in the W.H.O. SEPTIC WASTE REPORT.   http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/20328.php

Unsafe water and poor sanitation cause 4000 children to die each day according to World Health Organization.  But the problems associated with residential waste disposal are not limited to under-developed or third world countries.  Individual septic systems for treating residential sewage have long been used in sparsely populated areas in the U.S. where municipal systems are neither practical nor affordable.  The U.S. Census reports that there are over 26.1 million such systems in use in the US alone. 

The ProMark solution to this problem is the Purifier Septic System.  Unlike traditional septic systems The Purifier completes ALL of the sewage processing within its tank rendering leach/drain fields obsolete.  This is because the Purifier system is engineered to totally process and perform a final stage pasteurization rendering all harmful bacteria and pathogens harmless at the tank discharge. 

The premise of The Purifier’s biodegradation process is a reactive containment chamber, a sonic pulverizing section, stable settling (density separation and liquid layering), homogenizing and mixing section, filtering and aeration section, aeration and a final stage pasteurizing section.  

The engineering talent behind the Purifier System is a graduate of UCLA with several patents in this principle area of concentration centered in advanced organic chemistry.  Michael J Waddell, who heads up the marketing for the Purifier received his BA from the University of Iowa with Graduate Studies at the University of Missouri at Kansas City.  

ProMark is seeking $43,500 to build the manufacturing prototype and do proof of concept field testing of the Purifier Septic System.  This is a venture where the principles are putting “skin-in-the-game”.  The monies you contribute will be directly budgeted for fabricating the full size prototype, establishing field test sites along with some limited marketing in key territories. 

Here is why we believe that the Purifier is needed today:

Purifier Septic System™
  • Eliminates the spread of bacterial diseases (meningitis, E.Coli, etc) that can be introduced into the environment from poorly maintained or substandard      septic systems
  • Has no leach or drain field – consists of a single tank (processor) only
  • Provides (assures) a cleaner, safer, healthier environment. Ideally suited for use on hillsides, close to ponds, streams, the ocean, on islands and near reservoirs.
  •  Will be competitively priced.
  • Completely unaffected by weather conditions. Is totally unaffected by rainfall, soil conditions, or drainage.  Amount of rainfall, flood plain areas or the height of the water table can never influence the operation
  • Eliminated drain fields free up land that homeowners can use for other purposes. No contamination of ground around tank
  • The system is entirely fail-safe and will operate maintenance free as a      hands-off operation
  • Is adaptable to small communities
  • Gives a significant increase to the value of property
  • Pasteurization used as final step in purification; 100% of pathogenic bacteria are fully destroyed. 
  • Performance/efficiency easily monitored

The reason we are seeking the modest sum of $43,500  is because we have self-funded much of the costs like preliminary engineering and basic overhead. 

Based on preliminary contacts with householders and small villages that have existing septic problems we believe that the Purifier will quickly be embraced as the solution of choice.  Given the operational proof of the Purifier Septic System we believe that both end users as well as licensees will be knocking on our door to have access to the system. 

I hope that you will help us shortcut the “system” so that we may help stamp out water borne disease and return leach-bed land to good uses. 

For additional information you may request our 12 page white paper that will be sent on request via email:  mjw@promarket.com

Should you have interest in becoming a licensee or have other significant interests in the Purifier Septic System please contact us at: mjw@promarket.com

Distribution by ProMark.com

M. J. Waddell, Mkt. Director

1712 Genung Drive #10

New Albany, IN 47150

502-713-2750

mjw@promarket.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Orean Cosby.  I am a 63 year old mother of three children and 5 grandchildren. I am a gospel singer/songwriter, pastor and teacher. On January 14th, I was given the devastating news that the tissues that were removed during surgery was cancerous and although breast cancer has rarely been found in this area, it was indeed breast cancer.  My prognosis was Stage 4 breast cancer and it was later determined through testing that the cancer had metastisized throughout my entire skeleton.

Because I have experienced the affects of this diagnosis on my mental, emotional and physical well being, I have become more passionate about helping others in similar circumstances. Therefore I am sponsoring an afternoon of inspiration, hope, love, encouragment and prayer for other cancer and sickle cell anemia patient/survivors.

Although we may experience pain on a daily basis or have to endure hours of treatment, what goes on in the mind of those affected can do more damage than the condition itself.  I have experienced nights of fear and afraid to go to sleep wondering whether I would wake up in the morning or not.  But I thank God for the firm foundation of faith in the Word of God that reminds me and enables me to continue to live day by day holding on to my faith.  However, I come in contact with so many who do not have this kind of support and too many are dying before time due to the lack of inspirational, emotional, and mental support. And this is the purpose of the event called "The Gift"

What We Need & What You Get
 
We need $3,500 to defray the cost of the hotel ballroom where the luncheon will be held and to feed 50 patients and 50 caregivers.  Contributors will have the opportunity to visit the website to view pictures and/or videos of the events of the day. This event is being sponsored by Mashiyach Ministries, an IRS 501 (c) 3 tax exempt organization, therefore all gifts are tax deductible. If we are unable to raise the entire amount of this campaign, we will have to modify how many patients we will be able to accommodate. 

The Impact

In December 2010, I began this event,"The Gift" as a worship service in support of Sickle Cell Anemia. The very next month I received my diagnosis, so instead of cancelling the event, I added to the cause Breast Cancer.  There are many campaigns to raise money for research in the area of advanced breast cancer but I choose to do something that can personnally impact individuals right where they are. A smile, a touch, an encouraging word from another individual goes a long way toward the well being of a person. Some patients don't get out except for their doctors appointments and treatments. The impact of attending this social event and having folks there to show patient/survivors that someone cares and that their life and well being matters will go a long way in their hearts after the event is over. As a contributor, you will have the joy of knowing that you have helped to bring a glimmer of light into the hearts of 50 patients and caregivers.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who may not be able to contribute financially to this campaign, it would be very helpful if you utilize the "word of mouth" method to help us get the word out. Help me get the word out about helping breast cancer and sickle cell anemia patients/survivors receive HELP (H. hope, E. encouraging, L. love, P. prayer) from Mashiyach Ministries, Austin TX

story:
World Cup VI is in Kissimmee, Florida, which is quite a trek for us. As college students, we do not have a lot of money to travel so far. The money raised here will go towards our cars and vans that we will be driving down.

 Some pictures of our prizes are below:

Bracelet:

 

 

T-shirt:

Front

 

Back

 

Jersey:

Front


Back (with name)

 

Our shorts are still in the process of being made, so we do not have a picture to share with you at this time, but they'll be pretty awesome!
story_txt:
World Cup VI is in Kissimmee, Florida, which is quite a trek for us. As college students, we do not have a lot of money to travel so far. The money raised here will go towards our cars and vans that we will be driving down.

story:
My name is Bonnie Fisher and I am a married mother of two. My oldest is 22 and my youngest is 2 1/2 (no - that's not a typo!).

My husband is disabled and is unable to work or watch our toddler without assistance.  My oldest daughter suffers from chronic pain which severely limits her ability to work or chase after a toddler.

We need money immediately for rent, which includes utilities and late/legal fees or we will be evicted on Monday.

Your contributions will enable us to keep our home, and keep our family together.

Here's what you get for helping us:

Our friend Paladin from iTabletop is extending an amazing and generous offer - a limited amount of LIFETIME MEMBERSHIPS to iTabletop as perks!!

These lifetime licenses are only offered here, via this campaign, not from iTabletop.com directly.

Remember to include your iTabletop username in the comments to help Paladin assign your lifetime License to the right iTabletop account.

 

Thank you all!

 

EDIT FROM PALADIN - PLEASE READ: If the Perk you want is SOLD OUT, then just pick a less expensive perk, but still pay the amount the original perk cost.

For example, if the Full (not upgrade) perks that cost $185.00 are all taken, then grab an Upgrade from Sidekick, but change the amount to $185.00 before you submit. I'll know what you are doing and make it good :)

If there are no less expensive types available, then do a "No Perk" type of contribution, but enter the proper amount.

Post a comment if you're unsure what I'm talking about!

story:
**********MASSIVE UPDATE**********

We met funding goals, we will be going open source! 

What this means is that ANYONE who wants to make their own glove rather than buying from us can do just that. 


Project Info:

Imagine a world where a mother can watch for the first time as her blind child can grasp a glass of milk without fumbling to find it. 


Imagine a world where the equipment that a blind man needs to navigate is always with him, and takes up no extra space. 

Imagine a world where the blind can easily always know where everyone is around them, increasing their personal safty, as well as reducing the chance for accidental embarassment. 

This is the world this project is trying to create with your help. 

My name is Michael Frink, I am a computer engineering student, and advocate for the blind. 

This campaign is to raise money for a project of mine which is a ultrasonic device for the blind. I call it 'The Bat'. It will mount to the users hand and wrist, and shoot out ultrasonic pulses. The small microcontroller attacted to it will then use the data to give vibration feedback to the user. 

The end result will be a glove the user can wear which would act as a cane for the blind, only without having to physically contact objects. 

For testing I have several blind friends who are willing to give me feedback on how to make the project better suited for their needs and the needs of other visually impaired people. 

I sincerely believe that this project has the potential to touch many lives. 

What We Need and Perks for You:

We need funding for design and equipment. Right now I'm doing the design and construction for a single prototype. All money will go to sensors, microcontrollers, testing equipment, and so forth. 

Donations of $25 and above will recieve a signed 'Thank You' card from myself, and two of my blind friends who will be helping with the testing of the prototype!

Donations of $100 will get to pick an eight bar song that plays randomly when the device is first activated. Due to onboard memory limitations, only 20 songs will be avalible. 

Donations of $500 will get all the above perks, and have a 'Bat' Glove made and donated in their name to the Jackson School for the Blind. 

Anything above the requested total amount of $1500 will be used to make copies of the finalized prototype that will be donated to the Mississippi School for the Blind. I'll make as many as possible with the extra funds. 

Poject Details:

In recent years there has been a significant increase in the use of computerised systems as a form of assistive technology for the disabled. The visually impaired have recently gained access to computerized screen readers, enhanced magnification of visual imagery, and braille based computer systems. However, it seems that modern technology has not helped in assistance with location awareness. Rather than using the existing technological capabilities available, the visually impaired seem to be stuck with 19th century solutions of using service dogs and canes to traverse the world. It seems to be a strange paradox that, in a world filled with GPS devices and Internet accessible devices, the visually impaired should not be so limited in technological options for navigation.

The concept of this project is to create a low cost, hand mounted device which analyses the surrounding environment, then provides environmental data to the user through the use of haptic feedback in order to aid navigation for the visually impaired.

The navigation system is based primarily on the pioneering work of J.M. Loomis and his team's research into spatial analysis for the visually impaired. His work focused primarily on instrumentation which collected data in a 360 degree radius around the user, which was then fed into computer systems which provided vibrational feedback to the user based on the range of obstacles in all directions. The limitation of such systems is the cost due to large amounts of instrumentation, the vest which the user must wear which is both heavy and unfashionable, the potential of false positives due to movement of the users limbs, and excessive power consumption from the data analysis and necessary instrumentation.

The prototype that I am proposing uses the same concept of haptic feedback from data collected from instrumentation, but limits the flaws inherent in the systems designed by Loomis. By having a pair of ultrasonic range sensors mounted to the back of the users hand as the data collection system, the power consumption of the device is kept to a minimum, would be lightweight, and work in a manner similar to navigating with a cane; a skill that most visually impaired people have grown accustomed to.

TLDR; We are working on a low cost device to help blind people 'see'. 

If you can't donate:

If this sounds like a cool project but you just can't contribute, there are other things you can do to help!

You can get the word out about us on Facebook by sharing a link to this campaign! 

Tell everyone on your Twitter account!

Check out our Facebook page!

Share this fundraiser on your blog! 

e-mail your friends and family! 

Shout outs and thanks:

To Cory Doctorow, your speculative fiction works always inspired me. The book 'Makers' was one of my largest inspirations in life. 

To Ron and Marty Hale-Evans, thank you for your books 'Mind Performance Hacks', and 'Mindhacker'. 

To Mac David and Mytchi McKenzie, thank you for your friendship and allowing me to ask so many questions about how you navigate the world without eyesight. Without you, this project would be impossible. 

To Cy and Mia, thanks for watching out for Mac and Mytchi. You are the coolest guide dogs I have ever met. I hope my project doesn't take your jobs from you! 

To my Mom I want to thank for always supporting me, even when things seemed impossible. 

To my sister Dawn, I'd like to thank her for always pushing me to be my best, and for raising my second favorite nephew. :-p 

And a huge thank you to the countless number of teachers and professors out there who have helped me reach my goal. You have taught me what it means to choose to serve humanity. I hope this project can make you proud.
