story:
I apologize but due to a unexpected crisis I need to put this campain on hold. I am unable to cancel it according to Indiego policies so we ask that you DO NOT make a contribution at this time. Once able we will continue our fundraising efforts for a darn good cause....

 

In the 1970's there was 1 out of every 2,000. 

In 2000 it was 1 out of every 150.

By 2005 it became 1 out of every 100

Today it is now 1 out of every 88 children are being diagnosed as having some form of autism.

This is totally unacceptable, especially when considering how easy it can be to prevent this condition…

Newborn babies now enter this world already having several hundred man-made chemicals and heavy metals present in their blood. They then begin nursing where even more chemicals and heavy metals contaminants are potentially in their mother’s breast milk. 

Mercury, having been found in both newborns umbilical blood and mother’s breast milk when tested, is often used as a preservative in the medical industry because of its strong antimicrobial (antibacterial) properties.

This one substance alone could prove to have a devastating effect to the different types of micro flora that were meant to be passed from the mother to her newborn baby during the birthing and breastfeeding process. The micro flora is a complex network of trillions of health benefiting bacteria that have been found to play a critical role in the baby’s future growth and development, especially their immune system.                                                                    

                         Where is the mercury coming from?

Used for 175 years in the dental industry to make silver amalgam fillings, people with these type of fillings inhale and exhale the mercury vapors that is continually being released from them.

Used for 75 years as a preservative (Thimerosal) in children’s immunizations, flu, tetanus shots, medical creams, and eye drops.

A byproduct of fuel exhaust at ground level and coal burning that pollutes the upper atmosphere.

The increase production and improper disposal of fluorescent light bulbs which contain more mercury than incandescent bulbs. (Fluorescent lights also have a stressful effect on the body.)

With all of these, and many other, sources over the years having contributed to the contamination of air and fresh water sources.

A common symptom of autistic children is that they have inadequate amount of micro flora (beneficial bacteria) throughout their gastrointestinal tract, including the digestive system.

While many types of bacteria are killed by mercury there are a few strains that not only survive exposure to it they actually thrive when absorbing mercury inside their cell. After processing it they release a more harmful substance called methlymercury.

These types of bacteria can be found in different environments. In water they are responsible for contaminating different species of fish with methylated mercury making them dangerous to consume too much of. It needs to be questioned whether or not these same types of bacteria may possibly be present in people’s mouths and/or throughout the gastrointestinal tract, potentially converting the mercury contaminations in these areas into a much more toxic form within the body.

These are a few of the major contributing factors causing not just autism but many different health challenges which can surface at any time throughout a person’s life. The types of contaminants found in a newborns body and the effects these have to its development, including the micro flora needed for the immune system, can also lead to other diseases such as leukemia, multiple sclerosis, cancer etc.

It is a critical time for people to learn about the recent discoveries of how the human body functions and to reassess how their consumer choices may be affecting their health. Once this is accomplished the next goal should be to learn how to reduce and eliminate as many potentially harmful exposures as possible while properly protecting your everyday environments. This can all be easily achieved by visiting…

                                            www.3Steps2Health.com

 By checking out the valuable health information  presented here people can learn not only about the major causes of Autism, ADD/ADHD, Depression, Bipolar and other disorders but also of a wide variety of options that are available to effectively prevent or resolve the symptoms associated with these type of health conditions.

I am confident that visitors will quickly recognize, according to the importance of its content, the need for the development of a massive health awareness campaign. One with a strong objective in providing the type of education needed for people to begin actively preventing serious health issues on a large scale and social level.

With this in mind we have developed a strong business plan for providing environmental and consumer health education according to the times and the reality of the environment we now all live in.   To accomplish this we have recently launched a small network of websites to begin what, we hope, will grow into being a massive and worthy health awareness campaign.

Our ultimate goal in this is to provide the guidance and means for people to become self- reliant in meeting many of their own health care needs. By replacing potentially harmful synthetic chemicals with natural ones, ones the body has come to evolve with for thousands and thousands of years, people can best protect their health and their living environments.

3Steps2health.com describes the need for people to take the following 3 steps in order to effectively protect their health.

1.) Replenish micro flora for digestive & immune system support  
2.) Eliminate harmful substances from your body
3.) Eliminate harmful substances from your environments

For simplicity each of these steps is divided into 3 separate websites:. With each one of these providing pertinent information to health related issues and effective natural options that can be used to achieve that particular step.

As you will see by further exploring these sites, they are still in their beginning stages. While we have all the information needed to finish these in a very impressive and health benefiting way, I have decided it best to hand this task over to someone that is more skilled in both the art of effective writing and website design. LEARN WHY HERE

With much consideration, I have recently decided to get vocal and go social regarding these important, and avoidable, health conditions. I have reorganized my compilation of health information to be presented in a more meaningful way during a 2 day Environmental & Consumer Health Workshops in the Seattle Wa. area. You can learn more about our Health Workshops HERE

According to these sudden, but needed, changes that I have made towards these very worthy causes, we find it necessary to ask all you indiegogoers out there for some much needed support. Learn what kind of support we are in need of HERE

To those who are able to help support the significant goals that we have outlined here, we have made a few all natural perks just for you, or to give as “gifts of health” to others. We would like contributors to experience first-hand just how unique and beneficial our health awareness campaign is.

Whether you are able to make a financial contribution at this time or not, please do what you can to help get the word out about these important health issues and our awareness campaign…   Thank you for your support!

story:
Ian's Story

My nephew Ian. What can I say he is the most amazing child I have ever met with the most amazing sense of humor and always greats you with a smile. He is resilient and strong yet every day he faces pain constant pain.

Ian has what's known as EB (Epidermolysis Bullosa). you may ask "what is that"? Well it is an inherited connective tissue disease causing blisters in the skin and mucosal membranes, Its severity ranges from mild to lethal.

As a result, the skin is extremely fragile. Minor friction or trauma will separate the layers of the skin and form blisters. Often referred to as Butterfly Children due to the fact that their skin is as fragile as the wings of a butterfly. It's much like a severe burn in Ian's case all over his body. Ian lives in severe pain on constant pain medication to try to help keep him comfortable.

A bump or scratch or even moving the wrong way can case the skin blister and break. It's a constant battle, one area of the skin heals and then blisters again or won't heal at all. Scar tissue develops making it even worse restricting the movement of arms and legs and even opening the mouth. It doesn't stop there, blisters also develop internally in the eyes, nose, mouth and throat. For EB kids the risk of infection is high and can be fatal. Regular bandage changes are required and are nothing short of horrible and extremely painful.

Ian has also been diagnosed with Cirrhosis of the liver and his liver is leaking fluid into his adominal area. Ian is on medication to help reduce the fluid but the doctors are unable to work out why this is happening. They do not believe they will be able to stop this and can only treat it with medication in hopes to reduce the fluid.

In short it is a horrific disease, extremely painful and debilitating. Ian was born with RDEB which is considered to be a severe strain of this disease. Ian is bandaged from head to toe  with blistering and open wounds over most of his body. Ian is unable to walk and is confined to a wheel
chair. Ian can not sit up on his own or dress himself and requires constant care. When born Ian was not given much chance of survival and wasn't expected
to still be with us today. It is a shear miracle Ian is still with us today and has reached the age of 14.

87% of children born with one of the more sever forms of EB like Ian's do not live more then 12 months.

Ian enjoys arts and crafts, likes painting and drawing and watching the Food Network on TV. He enjoys spending time with his Brothers and Sister and his little kitten. Ian dreams of being a Firefighter when he grows up. He collects firefighting memorabilia and just loves all things do do with firefighting. He has an amazing attitude for a child who is in so much pain. With all the procedures he has to endure Ian still
manages to retain his sense of humor and I don't know how.


The cost alone of the trips to and from Cincinnati for long periods of time is to much for my sister to endure. Ian being confined to a wheel chair making travel all together difficult. By car it is an 8 hour drive from Pennsylvania to Ohio.

Ian and my sister will have to travel alone to Ohio and stay for long periods of time. Ian has always had trouble in recovering for any procedure and gets very sick after words during this recovery time Ian will not be able to travel home until he is 100%, again making the stays very long.

Ian's brothers and sister have to continue with school and my sisters husband has to continue work to keep the roof over their head and it is going to be impossible for them to manage all this without help. A one income family who is struggling to survive as it is can not possible manage this and that's why we need your help.

Our aim is to raise as much as we can to help cover the costs for Ian's trips to Cincinnati Ohio over the next year.

Any future medical care for Ian will be address in Cincinnati as they have the specialist with the experience needed to treat Ian. The local hospital where Ian has been treated feels that Ian's medical needs have become to specialized for them to continue to handle. So Ian will now be faced with traveling to Cincinnati for just about everything.

We just can't afford to cover the trips to Ohio and all the expences that are mounting daily. The family is struggling and recieves no assistance other then donations. They are a one income family fighting each day along side Ian.

If you could find in your heart to help Ian it would mean the world to Ian and his family. Any donation no matter how small can help. If you would like to offer any assistance at all in any way please email at helpian@hotmail.com.

We will be posting regular updates on Ian's Facebook Page, Twitter Page & Blog.

Facebook: www.facebook.com/ian.swarr.37 please follow Ian's Story.

You can visit Ian's web page: www.helpian.weebly.com

Follow Ian on Twitter: https://twitter.com/HelpIan1

It's much like a severe burn in Ian's case all over his body. Ian lives in severe pain on constant pain medication to try to help keep him comfortable. A bump or scratch or even moving the wrong way can case the skin blister and break. It's a constant battle, one area of the skin heals and then blisters again or won't heal at all. Scar tissue develops making it even worse restricting the movement of arms and legs and even opening the mouth. It doesn't stop there, blisters also develop internally in the eyes, nose, mouth and throat. For EB kids the risk of infection is high and can be fatal. Regular bandage changes are required and are nothing short of horrible and extremely painful.
Ian has also been diagnosed with Cirrhosis of the liver and his liver is leaking fluid into his adominal area. Ian is on medication to help reduce the fluid but the doctors are unable to work out why this is happening. They do not believe they will be able to stop this and can only treat it with medication in hopes to reduce the fluid.In short it is a horrific disease, extremely painful and debilitating. Ian was born with RDEB which is considered to be a severe strain of this disease. Ian is bandaged from head to toe  with blistering and open wounds over most of his body. Ian is unable to walk and is confined to a wheel chair. Ian can not sit up on his own or dress himself and requires constant care. When born Ian was not given much chance of survival and wasn't expectedto still be with us today. It is a shear miracle Ian is still with us today and has reached the age of 14.87% of children born with one of the more sever forms of EB like Ian's do not live more then 12 months. Ian enjoys arts and crafts, likes painting and drawing and watching the Food Network on TV. He enjoys spending time with his Brothers and Sister and his little kitten. Ian dreams of being a Firefighter when he grows up. He collects firefighting memorabilia and just loves all things do do with firefighting. He has an amazing attitude for a child who is in so much pain. With all the procedures he has to endure Ian still manages to retain his sense of humor and I don't know how.The cost alone of the trips to and from Cincinnati for long periods of time is to much for my sister to endure. Ian being confined to a wheel chair making travel all together difficult. By car it is an 8 hour drive from Pennsylvania to Ohio. Ian and my sister will have to travel alone to Ohio and stay for long periods of time. Ian has always had trouble in recovering for any procedure and gets very sick after words during this recovery time Ian will not be able to travel home until he is 100%, again making the stays very long. Ian's brothers and sister have to continue with school and my sisters husband has to continue work to keep the roof over their head and it is going to be impossible for them to manage all this without help. A one income family who is struggling to survive as it is can not possible manage this and that's why we need your help.Our aim is to raise as much as we can to help cover the costs for Ian's trips to Cincinnati Ohio over the next year.Any future medical care for Ian will be address in Cincinnati as they have the specialist with the experience needed to treat Ian. The local hospital where Ian has been treated feels that Ian's medical needs have become to specialized for them to continue to handle. So Ian will now be faced with traveling to Cincinnati for just about everything.We just can't afford to cover the trips to Ohio and all the expences that are mounting daily. The family is struggling and recieves no assistance other then donations. They are a one income family fighting each day along side Ian.If you could find in your heart to help Ian it would mean the world to Ian and his family. Any donation no matter how small can help. If you would like to offer any assistance at all in any way please email at helpian@hotmail.com.We will be posting regular updates on Ian's Facebook Page, Twitter Page & Blog.Facebook: www.facebook.com/ian.swarr.37 please follow Ian's Story. You can visit Ian's web page: www.helpian.weebly.comFollow Ian on Twitter: https://twitter.com/HelpIan1

story:
John is a special effects artist in the film industry, and for the past 30 years has worked on some of the most entertaining films to come out of Hollywood.
A caring and giving soul, he's always put the thought of others first.

In 2007, John was diagnosed with disabling Kidney disease, and has been on dialysis three times weekly since 2008.
Since that time his health has deteriorated due to the complications,
Advancement of the Kidney Disease has put a severe strain on his heart, enlarging it in the process as the build up of fluids has made it work extra hard to circulate blood.
In 2012 he was diagnosed with Congestive Heart Disease, and Fibromyalsia.

Daily activities are becoming a problem, as the disease is causing severe muscle cramping as the arms and legs become useless, making it difficult to walk, let alone function.
Long hospital stays have followed as his health has gotten worse. Ending in bills that are really starting to get incredibly high.
The fibromyalsia has caused nerve spikes and a real sensitivity to cold.

Due to technicalities in the Social Security system, no official government help has followed.
No disability has been issued at all, and no Medical help or insurance is being allowed.
In fact John isn't even on the list for a Kidney transplant.

Already Dialysis costs are in the hundreds of thousands and will continue.
And with no way to pay for the many prescriptions he needs, he is going without, and his condition is worsening fast.

It's becoming impossible for John to continue working, and with no steady income, and no disability help at all, John has been forced to live out of a truck under a freeway overpass, with no heat, no running water, and no access to the doctors and medicines he needs.

At this point regular foods everyone takes for granted can severely harm his body, as the restrictions he's on limit what he can eat.

The little food he can get at a distant help center, is not the best for his needs, often sending body levels of Phosphorous and potassium to dangerous levels, and ending up in more Hospital stays.

I'm asking for donations to help with his future bills, and to get him a place to live where he will be out of the elements, and into a place he can be warm and safe, and if possible, the money for a kidney transplant.

 

Thank you..

A.C.M.

story:
Who we are:

“Laneah” is a cosmetic line that will provide consumers with quality organic skin care and bath products that smell tempting enough to eat. The products include lotions, creams, moisturizers, body butters, bath salts, bath bombs, lip balms, hair mists. Our products will be available to order online as well as distributed at local farmers’ markets and health stores.

Our Vision:

We believe that it is important that the product not only feels good and is good for you , but also includes some of your favorite aroma. We will provide customers with the opportunity to customize their product with the smells they love.

Our products are safe, therefore if consumed by accident, it won’t harm the body. We believe in the simple concept that you shouldn’t smother on products that will be harmful to the insides of your body.

We focus on aroma, just as much as the rest of our ingredients. Smell should be pleasing, inviting, tempting, and amazingly delicious almost to the point of being addictive. This is a combination that most of today’s organic cosmetic producers lack. How frustrating is it to get this amazing lotion that has all of these nourishing qualities, but it doesn’t quite fit your taste of smell. Maybe you are a chocolate nut, who loves the smell of cocoa, chocolate, coffee, we got your stuff. Maybe you are a sweet tooth that dreams in cupcakes, candy, and everything sweet, we got you covered. Or maybe you are one of those “one with nature people” who love the smell of rain, freshly cut grass or a bed of flowers, we got it. How about the smell of pumpkin pie or freshly baked Christmas cookies in July, most manufacturers won’t have it, we got it for you all year round. Or maybe you are just sweet and fruity…you name it, we’ll whip it up for you.

Our product uses natural and refined vegetable and fruit oils and butters. They are enriched with natural vitamins and infused with herb extracts. Our products are themed to serve you better, some rejuvenate and moisturize your skin, while others (like our bath salts) use aromatherapy to help you sleep better, beat the sniffles, relax after a long hard day, or just hop in the bathtub for some extra mood boosting.

Who says that organic and natural has to be plane? We are flirty, we are sassy, and we will make you feel sexy and hip, while taking good care of your skin. You never have to worry about what’s in the bottle, the answer is simple “the goodness of nature.”  Vitamins are a crucial ingredient of a truly beautiful mind and body, but vitamins don’t have to take the shape of a pill, why not use the riches of nature to beautifully decorate your skin with nutrients.

Our story:

The idea was established in a desperate search for nourishing skin products that would not irritate sensitive skin types. It is the result of long and thorough researches of the qualities and nourishment that natural products provide that lead us to this point. The creator of Laneah, Aneia Hamberg has very sensitive skin and is prone to allergies and irritations. With a family history of occasional psoriasis, eczema, and allergies to sunscreen products, Aneia conducted extensive  research on the subject in search of  non-toxic solutions.

 

Scents available:

Chocolate Delight

Call Me Pumpkin

Banana Love

I Feel Coconutty

Carmel Latte

Soft Like Cotton Sweet Like Candy

Lemonicious

Secret Garden

 

Limited editions and special orders:

Roasted Almonds

Holiday Candy

Mango Fun-dango

A Rainy Day

Fancy Cupcakes

Hot Cocoa

Twisted Candy Canes

Christmas Cookies

Juicy Apples

Saucy Cranberries

story:
This is my wonderful mother with two of the more then 50 exchange students from 20 countries in which who's lives she has touched!  Its time for her to get back just a fraction of what she has given over the years! Please help out TATA!!



Short Summary

The scar tissue in my mothers esophagus is so severe she cant swallow anything. Over the years of uncontrollable acid reflux disease (severe heartburn) the acids from her digestive tract have eaten away the lining of the esophagus tube. Her tract is so narrow it fills with saliva and a bile type substance and blocks any food and drink from passing to the stomach. She is in so much pain she has to vomit over and over just to clear enough space to drink a smoothie or protein shake just to get enough nutrition to stay alive!! On a very rare occasion she can eat solid food, maybe once in a 2 to 3 week period. Her body is literally eating itself alive. The only other way to eat is I.V. But that doesn’t taste very good!! I listed a short video on the procedure she must have done to help her. However she must have two surgeries due to the severity of her case. Her job provides no health care!

First doctors must remove the scar tissue that has build up by stripping it off of her esophageal lining. This is a very painful procedure and must be preformed over several sessions. The second is in the video where they stretch her lining back out so the saliva and hopefully food can pass to the stomach. Once again this takes several procedures to take effect. Please help my eat again!! I would love to take her out for a steak or crab dinner instead of the smoothie shop!

My mother is a wonderful women, she works with multiple charities including a group that brings kids from countries like  Albania, Italy, Spain and England to name a few,and gets them involved with a Musical and theatrical group in Fort Worth for a theatrical summer camp. She takes on 2 of these kids a her home every summer. She is dedicated to share our culture with the world.

  • I am her son and am putting in $10,000 of my own money (that’s all I have)

  • We need to raise an additional $12,500 to cover the rest of expenses as well as time off work to make ends meet.

  • We must hurry, a great Doctor has given us some time but for discount work but we only have 2 weeks to raise he money!

  • My mother is a great and giving women, she needs your help and is to proud to ask herself.

  • With very little effort we can change her life!

  • She is a wonderful Mother, Grand Mother, and step mom to countless kids around the world! 

My Mother, her mother and her sisters.  We recently lost our NONI (the one in the middle) MY MOTHER WAS A SIZE 14 in this picture (far left)


This picture of my Mother, My son (short middle), Cousins right, and brother left!

Here my mom was a size 8..


Here with her dog Stoney, now a size 4.. She isnt on a diet!! SHE CANT EAT!!  Seems to get worse  every day..

My mother (on the left) and my awesome son, all the grand kids refer to her as TATA.  I dont want to tell my son that his TATA is leaving us anytime son when we can prevent this now!!


What We Need & What You Get

  • The $10,000 from me and the additional $12,500 from you fine folks will pay for medical procedures as well as recovery and time off work
  • Perks will be as below, I have a few good ones for you including trips to Las Vegas.
  • If our goal is reached my mothers life will change!! All funds to the penny will go directly to her health and recovery. 

The Impact

Imagine going thru life without real food, imagine having to go to the hospital just to eat from a tube because you cant swallow. Imagine if you could do something about it today!!

Save my mother so she can go on sharing with the world!

  • Make it real for everyone involved, I want this over Please HELP

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  •  use the Indiegogo share tools!Share with everyone!! Lets go!

story:
Grandma, who lives alone, is worried..

We all know stories of grandma or grandpa who are leaving their home of more than 30 years and reluctantly moving to assisted living facilities or nursing homes. Their family members give two main reasons. Any gradual deterioration in health for grandma usually goes undetected and surfaces only when there is an adverse event, such as a fall. Secondly, when the adverse event does happen, grandpa is afraid that there will be no one to find him and provide him timely medical care.

We have a solution..

Agility4Life addresses both these aspects and enables seniors to age gracefully at home without compromising on independence and the quality of life they have always cherished.

Agility4Life is building a radically improved health monitoring system, an easy-to-install in-home sensor solution, that continuously analyzes movement and gait patterns to provide general health assessments, detect and alert adverse events, such as falls or lack of movement, for seniors who live alone.

Our solution brings together latest sensor and imaging technologies to monitor seniors unobtrusively and uses sophisticated algorithms to recommend timely interventions by physicians, family members and caregivers only when needed, giving seniors complete privacy, while providing timely care. Unlike pendants, watches or other devices that seniors usually forget to carry or wear while at home, our system is unobtrusive, always-on and does not require the senior to do anything.

Another key differentiator for Agility4Life is that we are building a holistic solution that combines both preventative and responsive aspects of care, under the guidance of leading practitioners of geriatric medicine and the latest medical research.

With seniors, 65 and older, expected to reach 1.3 billion worldwide in five years, Agility4Life will solve a looming problem at a lower cost and serve a noble cause.

Who we are..

Agility4Life has been started by two Duke MBA alums - Uday Kiran Chaka (Daytime ’06), Justin Ho (Daytime ’06) and Seshadri Srinivasan, a PhD in Electrical Engineering. We were runners-up at linkAges Innovation Challenge organized by Palo Alto Medical Foundation & Health 2.0, and have continued to work on the idea. We are guided by reputed academics, geriatricians, and industry experts in this field. I have included more information about the core team towards the end.

Where we are in the journey..

We have a fully-working prototype that we are using for a beta trial with a Senior Housing organization in San Francisco and we are improving our algorithms continuously. Our prototype is based on hacked commodity hardware and proprietary software that work seamlessly to provide the most accurate information about the activity patterns of the seniors.

Our biggest challenge is to reduce the size of the prototype by building optimized hardware on our own. We are in touch with hardware designer and vendors who have assured us that a smaller form factor is feasible and reduce unit costs significantly.

You can help us hire the hardware vendor, build a smaller prototype, obtain regulatory approvals and manufacture the product in 2014. Without your help, we have to continue at our current pace and spend another year and launch our product in 2015. Help us improve lives of seniors sooner!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $25,000 to hire a hardware vendor to turn our prototype into a product. So far, we have been funding all the work on our own. We need your support to take us to the next level.

$10,000 will let us engage the vendor and start the miniaturization immediately.

Additional $15,000 will help us complete the testing, obtain regulatory approvals and create packaged products.

We thank our supporters (you!) warmly and want to recognize your contributions with valuable perks that you will love. Please contribute richly!

Impact of Your Contribution

2014 is a make-or-break year for us - we will make a viable product or close shop.

We have been working on this product for the past two years, spending countless hours away from family and friends, to make the world a better place for grandma and grandpa.

Your contributions will give us the needed encouragement to continue our good work. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not have a grandma or grandpa that needs our product. Your friends do!

If you are not able to fund us, please do spread the word - send emails to your family and friends, post our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Whatsapp or any communication channel that you use.

You can direct them to http://igg.me/at/agility4life/x/6010486


Thank You!


Core Team

Uday Kiran Chaka is an entrepreneur and management consultant with deep strategy, technology, and execution experience. He co-founded a mobile social gaming company, ran product management, sales and operations. He advised Fortune-100 firms on product development and supply chain operations. Uday worked at Pricewaterhouse Coopers (PwC), Cisco, HP, Infosys. He holds an MBA in Health Sector Management from Duke University and Bachelors in Technology from Indian Institute of Technology (IIT). He founded two nonprofit organizations that provide community service and promote healthy living.

Justin Ho is an experienced healthcare and management consulting professional with deep product management, marketing, sales operations, and technology experiences. He worked at Accenture, Boston Scientific, Cardinal Health, and Genentech. Justin holds MBA in Health Sector Management from Duke University and BS in Biomedical Engineering from Johns Hopkins University

Seshadri Srinivasan is a Sr. Staff Scientist, Product Lead, Feature Lead & Research Lead. He is an expert on Image Processing, Medical Imaging & Systems Engineering. He worked at Siemens Medical Solutions and startups. He has authored 11 patents overall and holds Ph.D in Electrical Engineering from Houston University and B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Anna University, India.

Adviser: Dr. Stacy Fritz, PHD, PTI, Program Director & Assistant Professor at University of South Carolina – Physical Therapy Program

Your friends do!If you are not able to fund us, please do spread the word - send emails to your family and friends, post our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Whatsapp or any communication channel that you use.You can direct them to http://igg.me/at/agility4life/x/6010486

Thank You!

Core TeamUday Kiran Chaka is an entrepreneur and management consultant with deep strategy, technology, and execution experience. He co-founded a mobile social gaming company, ran product management, sales and operations. He advised Fortune-100 firms on product development and supply chain operations. Uday worked at Pricewaterhouse Coopers (PwC), Cisco, HP, Infosys. He holds an MBA in Health Sector Management from Duke University and Bachelors in Technology from Indian Institute of Technology (IIT). He founded two nonprofit organizations that provide community service and promote healthy living.Justin Ho is an experienced healthcare and management consulting professional with deep product management, marketing, sales operations, and technology experiences. He worked at Accenture, Boston Scientific, Cardinal Health, and Genentech. Justin holds MBA in Health Sector Management from Duke University and BS in Biomedical Engineering from Johns Hopkins UniversitySeshadri Srinivasan is a Sr. Staff Scientist, Product Lead, Feature Lead & Research Lead. He is an expert on Image Processing, Medical Imaging & Systems Engineering. He worked at Siemens Medical Solutions and startups. He has authored 11 patents overall and holds Ph.D in Electrical Engineering from Houston University and B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Anna University, India.
Adviser: Dr. Stacy Fritz, PHD, PTI, Program Director & Assistant Professor at University of South Carolina – Physical Therapy Program

story:
Explore... Safely

Imagine international travel where you can enjoy the experience without worrying about your health or medical care.

Imagine carefree journeys with an App that gives you the tools to take care of your health and your family's health, seamlessly.

Imagine being free to make your own decisions by quickly accessing a complete health network designed to keep you informed, armed and prepared for any medical eventuality in your explorations, near or far.

We are a group of Business, Medical, Education and Technology professionals, who travel extensively for business, relaxation, adventure, and for the sheer fun of it; and we want to make the magic of travel available to all who dream of it, notwithstanding their state of health or remoteness of destination.

We have developed a website and mobile application that provides personalized health recommendations based on your health and wellbeing. This includes pre-travel and destination specific recommendations based on your unique health and medical needs. Pre-travel recommendations include vaccination types and locations where you can get them based on your current location.

While abroad, you will have access to itinerary specific, US Department of State recommended, English speaking medical providers, including specialists; as well as a searchable symptom-based reference for initial self care.

* Health recommendations based on YOUR medical conditions, medications and accessory medical devices.

* Vaccination recommendations based on YOUR vaccination history and itinerary requirements, AND vaccination clinics in your location.

* Real time health alerts during YOUR travel.

* Infectious disease alerts regarding locally prevalent diseases and outbreaks, personal safety alerts in the event of sudden political or economic change, severe weather and air quality alerts.

* Searchable symptom based resource to help you with initial self diagnosis; including early identification of potentially serious illness and emergency recommendations.

* Access to US State Department recommended hospitals, medical providers and specialists in YOUR travel location if medical care becomes necessary.

Our Story

An Executive, an Entrepreneur, a College Professor and a Doctor walked into a bar.... And an idea was born. 

Well, actually, this idea became a passion because we believe in the freedom to travel, to explore, to learn and experience. We are working now to remove personal barriers to this freedom and we ask you to join us.  In our own travels,(and we do a lot of this!) we noticed how difficult it was sometimes to be able to find trustworthy pharmacies and doctors while in distant land.  We also felt strongly that those distant lands had all these things, but when time was short, we lacked a quick, easy way to find them! Some of our friends postponed or put off their own travel dreams because of this worry.  No-one can afford not knowing where to go if they fall sick in an unfamiliar country. So, since we seriously love to travel, and we feel that every human being should be able to follow their wanderlust no matter the state of their health, we created MyTravelRx: your prescription to carefree travel.

Meet The Team

Nikhil Mehta MD, FACS: Specialist in surgery and emergency medicine; mountain climber and backpacker. 

Vineet Dalal, MBA: Marketing executive and software engineer, global business traveler and Green Technology expert

Sonia Mehta, PhD: Professor, mom, environmental and animal rights activist.

Ray Chirayath, MBA: Technology entrepreneur, global traveler and baritone par excellence.

Plans for the Future

What we have designed here is Phase I.  We have very exciting plans to launch added features and functionality to this service... stay tuned

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $50, 000 in this stage to be ready to be of service in almost every country in the world.

The Impact

  • This is the only service of its kind in operation at this time.
  • It was built on a need by real people in real places.
  • By joining us, you become a part of a community that does not only believe in the power of travel to change and enrich lives, you are also among those who make it possible for millions to take the trips of their lifetimes.
  • You will help make travel more safe and travelers more protected.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us financially, we would be very appreciative if you help spread the word... become a fan of our facebook (https://www.facebook.com/MyTravelRx?ref=br_tf) and twitter (https://twitter.com/MyTravelRx) pages.  And just keep those positive thoughts and wishes coming...

story:
The National Alliance to End Sexual Violence's (NAESV) $5 for 1 in 5 Fundraiser spotlights the statistic that nearly 1 in 5 women have been raped in their lifetime because it illustrates the pervasive scope of sexual violence. The $5 for 1 in 5 fundraiser aims to garner awareness of sexual violence and raise funds to support the NAESV 's work towards health, safety, and a future free of sexual violence.

__________ WHAT YOU CAN DO__________

   

Help us to be your voice in Washington, DC to end sexual violence!


In 2013, the NAESV…

•  Successfully co-led advocacy efforts to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act (VAWA) including historic protections for survivors of sexual violence and marginalized communities.

•  Secured $2 million dollars in additional funding for the Sexual Assault Services Program in the final FY14 appropriations bill and maintained the Preventive Health and Health Services Block Grant with the sex offense set-aside.

•  Co-led national appropriations coalition to successfully increase the VOCA cap by $15 million.

•  Coordinated national sexual assault organizations to better support the work of coalitions.

•  Provided leadership to the CDC to ensure prevention dollars remain with community-based agencies and state coalitions.

•  Worked closely with Senator Gillibrand's office toward passage of the Military Justice Improvement Act and convened and coordinated national coalition advocacy efforts on military sexual assault.

•  Acted as a liaison to the White House and the federal government on a variety of federal projects related to sexual assault.

•  Provided comment to various federal agencies on issues related to sexual assault including VAWA housing provisions, VOCA regulations, and protections for campus victims.

•  Provided webinars to coalitions on a variety of VAWA implementation issues.

•  Provided media responses on high-profile cases and sexual assault news including the recent Op-Ed in the Wall Street Journal.


Donate now to help us reach these goals in 2014:

•  Further increase funding for sexual assault services

•  Double our media presence through letters and Op-Ed responses to high-profile cases and sexual violence news

•  Continue to send grassroots alerts activating advocates on policy and funding issues

•  Persuade additional members of Congress to request funding for sexual assault survivors

•  Continue to meet with key appropriators to fight for survivors

•  Advocate with the administration for: housing protections for survivors, rights of campus survivors, needs of military survivors with PTSD, building evidence for prevention programs, and the needs of youth survivors of sex trafficking      


About NAESV

The NAESV's mission is to provide a missing voice in Washington, DC for state coalitions and local programs advocating and organizing against sexual violence and for survivors.

The NAESV educates the policy community about federal laws, legislation, and appropriations impacting survivors and the fight to end sexual violence. Our team of experts and advocates publish written analysis, track legislation, provide media interviews, and advise members of Congress and the executive branch.

Leaders from statewide anti-sexual violence organizations joined with local rape crisis centers and prominent national advocates to create the National Alliance to End Sexual Violence. 

             

National Alliance to End Sexual Violence is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization. Donations are tax-deductible to the extent of the law.


The Sky Is The Limit!

Other pathways to support survivors of and advocate against sexual violence:
+Investigate and learn.
+Educate and inform.
+Raise your voice and speak out.
+Help Change Happen.

story:
Aloha Jerky Aficionados!

Creating a Gourmet Beef Jerky that is delicious and affordable has been my passon!  I LOVE to cook! Most store bought Jerky is tough or tasteless.  They are made with additives and preservatives that are not healthy for us!  I wanted to make a Jerky that was unique, healthy and delicious. 


Eye of Round

We start with Eye of Round beef.  It is an expensive cut  But quality is number one  with Hawaiian Dave.  It is lean, 97% fat-free, and tender.  Not too much marbling like some cuts, but enough to give it the right amount of flavor.  We cut it across the grain.  This makes it easy to chew.  If you've ever had steak that you could cut with a fork, that's how it is to chew jerky that's been cut across the grain.  Then we marinade it for over 16 hours overnight in our special blend of ingredients and spices.  Most jerky is marinaded for just a few hours giving you just a taste of the flavor, but like chewing gum the flavor's gone in just a few seconds.  Our Jerky has the flavor through and through with every chew!

 

Eye of Round Beef - 97% Fat-Free

Four Delicious Mouthwatering Flavors:


Original Gourmet Teriyaki Beef Jerky

 

Our Original Teriyaki, starting with a Teriyaki based flavor, we add our special blend of ingredients, Worchershire sauce, brown sugar, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, pepper to give you a sweet, unique taste you'll enjoy to the last chew!

Sweet & Sour Gourmet Teriyaki Beef Jerky

Our Sweet & Sour tastes similar to our Original only we sweeten it a little more and give it a lemon coating on the outside of the jerky so you've got that "Sourball" or "Tearjerker" effect!

BBQ Gourmet Teriyaki Beef Jerky

 

Our BBQ adds Liquid Smoke, Frank's Red Hot Sauce, and some Hot Mustard for a nice kick to our Teriyaki Base Flavored Jerky! 

Volcano Gourmet Teriyaki Beef Jerky

Our Volcano Flavored Jerky Brings On the Heat!!! With Five, Count'em Five different Heat Inducing ingredients...this Treat is bound to set your mouth on FIRE!!! Step away from the LAVA Flow!

 

Testimonials

Whether you like it Sweet or Hot or even BBQ Flavored, It's all about taste and texture with our Gourmet Beef Jerky!  Here's what some of our customers have said:

Wendy S. from Chapel Hill, NC posted on her Facebook page, " My friend Dave makes some AWESOME Beef Jerky!"

Stephanie A. from Cary, NC says, "Your Volcano Jerky is the Bomb!  I'm going to have to give up smoking so I can buy it because it's so addicting!"

Joe F. from Boston, MA says, "This is the most flavorful Jerky I ever had!"


What the Funds will help us to do!

I have customers who have all but begged me to start up a plant to get the word out that there is a better Jerky.  It takes a little change to get a facility up to USDA standards.  But once it's up, marketing is the key!!! That's where the majority of the funds will be spent.  I've developed a network of contacts in various parts of the country that are willing to help me launch this project BIG TIME, however it will take a little jingle to get in position(Set up our Facility, Produce Inventory, Advertise and Marketing) to Catch and Ride the Wave all the way to the shore!!! 

We will attend various events, fairs, festivals. I've got a data base of over 500 clients who have purchased our products.  Social Media will play an important part in getting the word out as well!  Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin etc. etc.

Help us to get the word out, "The World Needs Hawaiian Dave's Gourmet Beef Jerky!" It's delicious, healthy and affordable!!!

Mahalo!

Hawaiian Dave

David A. Kauwe

story:
Who is this for?


My father, Renato Sandoval,  has recently suffered a heart attack, and though he gained some time, unfortunately things have not gotten much better and he needs to be operated upon. The medical bills will amount to possibly a few tens of thousands of dollars, and so if anyone wants to help and contribute (any size, as every little helps), then that would be more than greatly appreciated. 

As well as being my father, he is also a poet and a translator and overall a man of letters, as well as the organiser of Lima's International Poetry Festival. You can also read an interview of his (in Spanish) in the newspaper El Comercio regarding his current situation at the link below. The link also includes a bank account to which the transfer can alternatively be made to, as well as a Western Union account.

If you cannot contribute, you can still forward this to those people you think may be interested and capable in doing so!

story:
HWYD?

How was your day?
A moodtracker with the functions you miss in other moodtracker, we not tracking only your mood in a simple way

  • Your mood
  • Message, location, temperature, take a photo and share with friends 
  • Quantified Self

If you want to track and understand your moods, this will be the app!

What We Need & What You Get

We would love to raise some money to be able to expand the team and get this to market as quickly as possible. The only thing this money will be used is people. We just want to hire two extra developers.

  • If we raise €20.000 we will use that to pay two developers €2300 a month.
  • The remaining money will be used to hire free-lance Android/Windows Phone 8 developers. 
  • If we won't raise the full amount of funding that will just mean we have to work harder.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want to contribute money we would still appreciate your help. This is what you can do:

Get the word out about HWYD via Twitter, Facebook or email.

story:
Our Campaign

  Hello, my name is Adel Elseri and I am the proud inventor of the "Tongue2Teeth", the world's first tongue-mounted toothbrush. I am a boilermaker by trade, but I've had a passion for oral hygiene for my entire life. 

  My campaign started when I found the need to brush my teeth, on-the-go, without actually having a toothbrush and toothpaste with me. I wanted it to be discreet and convenient because I knew that chewing gum and using mouthwash wouldn't have the same effect of physically cleaning my teeth, tongue and gums. The "T2T" is a "dispoable after one use" device, adding to its conveniency. Each unit has a coating on the inside that kills bacteria on the tongue, however, a toothpaste coating on the outside that whitens your teeth and protects your gums. With its unique packaging, the "T2T" has a hands-free exchange method which elimates any possibility of contamination.

  By receiving your contributions, we will be able to finalize the "Tongue2Teeth" and make it an internationally renowned product. With your help, the "T2T" will allow people with physical disablities to regain their independance by brushing their own teeth.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  We are aiming to raise around $100,000 to fund more research & development on the proper CSA/FDA material needed to perfect the "T2T". Currently, we have developped our first prototype with micro pyramids as the primary cleaning tool, we also have a second prototype in the works  that uses bristles for the cleaning action. At this time, we have temporary packaging, that can be seen in the video above, that shows the concept of hands-free exchange, however, added funds will allow us to make our packaging even more convenient for the consumer. 

The Advantages of Tongue 2 Teeth

  • Disposable after one use
  • Discreet
  • Extremely convenient for on-the-go use
  • Hands-free brushing
  • Zero contamination
  • Contacts your entire mouth
  • Creates a healthy oral environment
  • Giving independance to people with physical disabilities

 

What We've Accomplished So Far...

Since our first exposure on our local newspaper, the "Edmonton Journal", we have:

  • Been published on the Huffington Post, the Montreal Gazette, MSN Now, Ripley's Believe It or Not and the Daily Mail
  • Appeared on The Dragons' Den, Global TV Edmonton and CTV British Colombia
  • Been invited to appear on The Today Show and on Anderson Cooper when we have finalized the product 
  • Went viral

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean that you can’t help:

  • Follow us on Twitter (@Tongue2Teeth) and tweet away!
  • Like and follow us on Facebook (T2T) 
  • Spread the message of the FRESH REVOLUTION!
  • Find other ways to help people with physical disabilities regain their independance

I wanted it to be discreet and convenient because I knew that chewing gum and using mouthwash wouldn't have the same effect of physically cleaning my teeth, tongue and gums. The "T2T" is a "dispoable after one use" device, adding to its conveniency. Each unit has a coating on the inside that kills bacteria on the tongue, however, a toothpaste coating on the outside that whitens your teeth and protects your gums. With its unique packaging, the "T2T" has a hands-free exchange method which elimates any possibility of contamination.
  By receiving your contributions, we will be able to finalize the "Tongue2Teeth" and make it an internationally renowned product. With your help, the "T2T" will allow people with physical disablities to regain their independance by brushing their own teeth.
 


What We Need & What You Get
  We are aiming to raise around $100,000 to fund more research & development on the proper CSA/FDA material needed to perfect the "T2T". Currently, we have developped our first prototype with micro pyramids as the primary cleaning tool, we also have a second prototype in the works  that uses bristles for the cleaning action. At this time, we have temporary packaging, that can be seen in the video above, that shows the concept of hands-free exchange, however, added funds will allow us to make our packaging even more convenient for the consumer. 
The Advantages of Tongue 2 Teeth

Disposable after one use
Discreet
Extremely convenient for on-the-go use
Hands-free brushing
Zero contamination
Contacts your entire mouth
Creates a healthy oral environment
Giving independance to people with physical disabilities


 


What We've Accomplished So Far...
Since our first exposure on our local newspaper, the "Edmonton Journal", we have:

Been published on the Huffington Post, the Montreal Gazette, MSN Now, Ripley's Believe It or Not and the Daily Mail

Appeared on The Dragons' Den, Global TV Edmonton and CTV British Colombia

Been invited to appear on The Today Show and on Anderson Cooper when we have finalized the product 
Went viral


Other Ways You Can Help


Just because you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean that you can’t help:

Follow us on Twitter (@Tongue2Teeth) and tweet away!
Like and follow us on Facebook (T2T) 
Spread the message of the FRESH REVOLUTION!

Find other ways to help people with physical disabilities regain their independance

story:
My name is John William Brisson. I have worked for a vitamin company for over 3 years, and I am currently going to school to get a degree in Biology. I have also been a practicing naturopath for the past 5 years. All of this changed for me on June 24, 2011, when my youngest son was diagnosed with CMEMS. CMEMS is an extremely rare genetical disorder (only five children have been diagnosed in the world with it other than him).

I dedicated my life to take care of my son, and in my spare time I write. I am now working on a book that I think that can help people suffering from digestive problems. I need to raise money to set up a website, hire a graphic artist, and hire a formatter as well.

This book is my life and a collection of all my work. I understand the struggle that people have when they are suffering from digestion problems. I have, myself suffered from LERD, for three years and have successfully treated myself.

A basic overview of my book, the topics in my book will include:

How the Digestive System Works

Herbal and Nutritional Supplement Listing and Information

Antibiotic Guide and Medicines Used to Treat Digestive Conditions

Tips to Improve Digestive Health

Standard Diagnostic Procedures and Information

Probiotic Guide and Information (All The Different Types and Uses)

Supplement Brand Recommendations

Protocols for Most Digestive Diseases (GERD, LERD, SIBO, Gastirits, Gastroparesis, IBS, IBD, Esophageal Motility Disorders)

Protocols for Colon Cleansing and Parasite Elimination

Protocols for Constipation, Diarrhea and food poisoning

Protocol to treat Candida, H. Pylori, and C. Diff Infections

Information on Diets

Gastrointestinal Cancer General Information and Alternative Treatments

The opening to my book:

There is an average of seventy million American’s diagnosed with digestive disorders every year. More Americans are rushing to their doctors to treat conditions like heartburn, gas, GERD, SIBO, IBS, ulcerative colitis and Crohns disease. More digestive diseases and problems are also being discovered every day. The most concerning aspect of all these conditions is that science and natural medicine are way ahead of the curve in treating all of these problems. Even though this is true most people only rely on conventional medicine. Conventional medicine is great for emergency procedures and life threatening conditions, but has a horrible tract record for treating preventable conditions and diseases.

Examples of Mainstream Medicine Being Wrong About Digestive Issues

1.     Ulcers were only caused by stress and too much stomach acid. Scientists discovered in the 1980’s that H. Pylori was the main cause of stomach ulcers. Mainstream medicine didn’t accept this fact until the mid 1990’s. Millions of Americans were mistreated with antacids, H2 antagonists, and PPI’s. H. Pylori as the main cause of ulcers was never addressed during this time and may patients suffered.

2.    Another common misconception is that the only cause of Heartburn is excess acid in the stomach.  Since most people have a basic understanding of physics (that doctors seem not to grasp), stomach acid can't travel up the esophagus by itself because of gravity. Also the LES prevents stomach contents from leaving the stomach as much as possible (this would explain why stomach acid doesn’t come up when you lay down or are upside down). Excess stomach acid cannot be the sole reason for GERD. GERD can be caused by too little stomach acid, which over time causes gas buildup in the stomach and small intestine. GERD can also be caused by a weakened LES from gas pressure, Hiatal Hernia putting pressure on the stomach and LES, SIBO, and Lack of Digestive Enzymes leading to increased gas and food allergies.

3.     Ulcerative Colitis and Crohns Disease sufferers are also having the same problem today, since science has already proved that these diseases are caused by the Mycobacterium Avium. The main source of Mycobacerium Avium in humans is improperly pasteurized milk. Mainstream medicine still treats these conditions as only autoimmune disorders sadly.

All of these can be treated with simple supplementation and lifestyle changes. Mainstream medicine will only offer medicine for the rest of one's life as an answer to these medical problems. One of the proposed reasons why the actual cause of these diseases isn’t addressed properly is because the huge amount of money that can be made if a patient is on the drug for the rest of their life.

Most doctors, pharmacists, chemists, mean well and don’t understand the damage they are doing. But most of the management of the AMA, pharmaceutical companies, and FDA are in bed with one another and lobby to keep people from true medical freedom.

Honestly, I am just a researcher and everything presented in this book is just my opinion based on research. The rest of this book is dedicated to the study and treatment of most digestive disorders for the average person. I suggest you also work with a trustworthy doctor, PA, Nurse Practitioner, Nutritionist, Naturopath or Chiropractor that can help you get on a path of better health.

Sample Protocol


SIBO / Leaky Gut Syndrome

 

SIBO is a medical condition where a person has too many bad bacteria in their small intestine. This is usually caused by both a poor American diet and long term use of a PPI drug (Proton Pump Inhibitor). Long term use of PPI’s causes bacteria that would normally be eliminated by stomach acid, to survive and flourish in the small intestine. Also the American diet of fermenting carbohydrates causes the bacteria to thrive and produce lots of excess gas. The lack of stomach acid also causes food proteins to be partially undigested which causes allergies to develop and this causes even more gas to build up.

The bacteria also make protective biofilms (one of the most common examples of a biofilm is the “film” found on your teeth when you don’t brush for awhile) which make eradication with antibiotics very difficult.  The biofilm protect the bacteria from antibiotic treatment, bactericides, and probiotics. To destroy the opportunistic bacteria you have to also destroy the biofilm that it is hiding behind. This can be obtained by either breaking down the biofilm itself using systemic enzymes or by chelating the Iron out of the biofilm to break it up by using either Calcium Disodium EDTA or NAC.

The main symptoms of SIBO are indigestion, lots of gas, and horrible smelling deification, burps, and flatulence. Most people with IBS are walking around with SIBO as their main cause of their problems. Other symptoms of SIBO include abdominal pains, constipation and/or diarrhea, food allergies, and low grade fever. One of the biggest correlations between a condition and a disease are Rosacea and SIBO. In one major study 96% of Rosacea patients were in remission or cured for at least 9 months after taking Rifaxmin to treat their SIBO.

A hydrogen breath test is used to diagnose SIBO. It is a non-invasive fasting test done in which a doctor has you breathe into a machine that monitors the excess hydrogen or methane that is released by the extra opportunistic bacteria in your small intestine. You are either given glucose, dextrose, or lactulose and results are collected at twenty minute intervals for at least 3-5 hours. If you produce at least 20 ppm of hydrogen or methane then you are positive for sibo (but even a result of 12 ppm should be treated at the very minimum). Lactulose is the best to use because it isn’t absorbed by the intestinal tract itself. Glucose is easily absorbed by both the bacteria and the intestines. This means it can give a false reading because at least 17 ft of the small intestine will not be tested because of the quick glucose absorption.

Are Opportunistic Bacteria The Main Cause of Leaky Gut?

The excess bacteria in the small intestine can wreck havoc with your health and lead you digestion into a vicious cycle. The more opportunistic bacteria in your small intestine, the more food they consume which can lead to nutrient deficiency of B 12 and Iron, which then leads to the patient developing anemia. The bacteria also consume more nutrients that are now unabsorbed by the gut which leads to both more bacteria and gas production. This leads to abdominal bloating, pain, and flatulence.

The bacteria then start to decrease fat absorption which leads to stool problems with color / fat content and this also leads to deficiencies in vitamins A and D. The intestinal lining further degrades and eventually can’t digest larger food particles which cause food allergies and sensitivities (gluten first, then usually followed by fructose problems, then lactose digestion problems).

Bacteria then enter the bloodstream from the loss of integrity in the intestinal wall and start an immune reaction that causes fatigue, systemic pain, and elevated liver enzymes. Finally, the bacteria start to excrete acids that cause neurological and cognitive problems like brain fog and memory problems. The cycle then continues as the body’s Immune system tries to kill of the opportunistic bacteria which at the same time poison the body with acids and toxins. The vicious cycle then repeats itself in the patient, who becomes sick for a very long time.

Simple to Moderate Cases of SIBO


For 2 weeks / 4 weeks:

PERFERRED: Nature’s Way Enteric Coated Peppermint Oil: 30 min - 1 hour before meals, 2x a day

OR

Choose One Strong Anti-Microbial: Colloidal Silver (Mesosilver, Sovereign Silver, SuperNatural Silver), Oil of Oregano (North American Herb and Spice), Thorne Research Berberine 500 mg: 2 capsules a day, Allicin-C

PERFERRED: Interfase Plus - Follow Instructions Should be taken on Empty Stomach

OR CHOOSE ONE OF THE FOLLOWING

1,200 mg Jarrow NAC Sustain: Take 600 mg Twice a Day on Empty Stomach

Jarrow Formulas Lactoferrin: Follow Supplement Instructions (I would suggest starting at around 125 mg, if not a strong herx reaction may happen)


Extra Virgin Coconut Oil - 2 tbsp's a day

Bulletproof Diet COMBINED with FODMAP Diet for Three Months

<Enteric Coated Peppermint Oil has been found to have strong antibacterial activity in the gut and is also antispasmodic which is why it has been studied greatly for IBS.

Interfase is a great enzyme combination, the enzyme dissolves the biofilm, the Calcium Disodium EDTA chelates Iron out of the biofilm to break it up and pull the biofilm away.

The NAC or lactoferrin will do the same thing as the Interfase by chelating the Iron out of the biofilm.

Coconut Oil is used to kill any excess yeast in the colon.>

Severe Cases of SIBO

For How Long you are taking the Antibiotic:

Rifaxmin – an antibiotic that only stays in the gut and is poorly absorbed.

Interfase Plus - Follow Instructions Should be taken on Empty Stomach

OR CHOOSE ONE OF THE FOLLOWING

1,200 mg Jarrow NAC Sustain: Take 600 mg Twice a Day on Empty Stomach

Jarrow Formulas Lactoferrin: Follow Supplement Instructions (I would suggest

story:
Real Fit Women Magazine - Helping Women Over 30 Get Fit!

My name is Casey Stevens and I am 30 years old! 

Instead of viewing my 30th birthday as low light in my life I decided to turn it in to a postive and help others along the way.

Being fit and healthy is something that I am extremely passionate about so I created Real Fit Women, a fitness magazine for women over the age of 30.

Real Fit Women magazine is sold through Apple's Newsstand and is for iPad users only. By using the Apple's Newsstand and App Store I can keep the cost low, save paper and reach people in any country that has an App Store.

Check Out The Magazine Here:

http://youtu.be/RTiykRlN7P0

The first issue of the magazine launched in the last week of January 2013 and has had some amazing response from women all over the world with 100 subscribers in the first month!

Some of the articles in the first issue were:

   

Why Would You Care About This Campaign?

If you're a woman over 30 you know what it's like to feel that your best days are behind you. Even if you know that's not true, you've more than likely had the thought.

THIS IS NOT TRUE!! And you know it.

There are plenty of campaigns out there focussing on younger woman and body image. But what about us? 

I truly believe this a valuable and worthwhile project. 

We must show ourselves that we may be over 30, but our life is not over by any stretch of the imagination.

 

What Real Fit Women Magazine Needs 

As the current publisher, editor and general dogs body of the magazine I have been doing everything myself.

This includes collecting content, articles, case studies, design, creating the magazine, publicity, even being the workout model for the workouts in the magazine. And currently it is a full time job, but unfortunately I need to work to pay my bills.

As I don't have any sponsers or advertisers for the magazine I have come to Indiegogo.

I have estimated the bare minimum that it will cost to publish 12 issues of the magazine. And that is what I am seeking here .

All funds received will go to:

- hiring a person to put together the magazine each month 

- the hard costs of the software I use to creat an application that meets Apple's high standards

That will leave my time free to source great content, interview inspiring women and bring you one amazing magazine.

 

Your Generous Contributions Will Not Go Unnoticed!

For those people who believe in what I am trying to do here and feel this is something they want to get behind I am offering the best subscription deal that you will ever see!

For a full breakdown of each perk level please read the column to the right -->>

The subscriptions come in:

3 months

6 months

12 months

There are Real Fit Women wrists bands on offer.

Also you can buy a subscription for a friend or family member or whoever you feel would benefit from the magazine.

And don't forget you can donate as much as you would like :)

There are also some downloadable workout dvd's and a digital recipe book planned for later in 2013 which you can get access to.

If there is a perk you would like please let me know and I'll do my best to source it :) 

Please take note: Real Fit Women magazine is available only on Apple's Newsstand. That means you need an iPad to read it.

Please feel free to contribute if this resonates with you, however you MUST have an iPad to view the magazine.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to contribute but can't do so financially that's cool. No dramas. Another way you can help is by sharing this campain. 

You can share it on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, your own website, via email and with friends and family that you feel would be interested in this project or benefit from the magazine.

Simply share the link: 

Or use one of the IndieGogo share tools.

I will be forever grateful :)

 

If you would like to know more or have any questions please don't hesitate to get in touch either via Indiegogo or RealFitWomen.com

story:
Final Message:

I just wanted to say that I am humbly grateful for all of the donations recieved from family, friends and complete strangers. You have really touched my heart in so many ways. Even if I don't make the goal, I will keep what was donated and continue to save until I have enough to get my surgery (ie not going to splurge on new camera gear). I will also put a donation button on my site a few days after this fundraiser, just so if someone wishes to donate some extra cash, they will able to do so.

Finally, thanks again to all my close friends for helping me out in so many ways. I could not have done it without you!

Thank you again!

-Kevin Clifford


********************************************************************************************

The Story

Hello, my name is Kevin Clifford. I recently returned from Japan where I had been teaching English to the local children. While there, I experienced a wonderful and unique culture. One major event that I loved was experiencing New Years with thousands of people at Tokyo Tower and seeing thousands of hope balloons launch into the air at once. Unfortunately, because of the frequent earthquakes, continued threats of tsunamis and nuclear meltdowns that were escalating in Japan, I was forced to return to the United States on short notice and on very limited funding.  I returned home with less than $200 to get my life started again. Shortly after coming back to Reno, Nevada, I was attempting to find a new job (that would supplement my photography) when I hurt myself.  Little did I know, a groin (Inguinal) hernia had been forming for quite some time before becoming enlarged and quite painful.

Many people can deal with hernias for many years before surgery. However, some people need surgery sooner rather than later. A hernia can be a medical emergency if it gets too big, which can cut the circulation off in the area. If I were to get a job with benefits ASAP, I would have to wait at least 3 months before being covered on insurance. However the job market is less than stellar and with more jobs shedding benefits, I feel it would be difficult to get the surgery within a year.  

Photography is my passion and I have done a several outlandish things to get "the shot," which include going into a wildfire with a fire crew and photographing as an adult cheetah ran towards me while un-caged. But it's not only the amazing and wild things that I have gotten to do so far (and hopefully more in the future). It's the people that I got to share those experiences with. I have made many close friends across the globe while on my photo adventures. And when I mean close, I don't use that term lightly. I met my close friends though photography; either as photographers themselves, co-workers, subjects, assistants or a random person on the street. I love each and every one of them with everything I have and if it came down to it, I will sell every piece of photography gear that I own just to get fixed so I could spend one more day to hang out with them. The gear doesn't matter…the people do.

Even though I am willing to sell everything I own, I don't wish for it to come to that just yet. I communicate through photography as a painter communicates through his/her art. Hell, I think I communicate better with photography than speaking (which is one reason that I can be "too honest" ). Also, I love to be invited (and to invite people) on photo adventures and it helps to be able to do the same activity as the rest of my friends and without using all their gear. It's the small moments, such as going on photo shoots, coming up with new ideas, or just hanging out that I cherish deeply.

This hernia is holding me back from everything I enjoy: my friends, family, work and my hobbies. Further, I know that you could be donating to someone who has cancer, is homeless, etc, and someone with a hernia is often viewed as "less deserving." However, I would love to get this behind me so that I can bet back to "normal" . I can't offer too much, but my friends and I are willing to donate our time and beautiful photographs to you if you do wish to donate.

Thank you for your time and please check out some of my friends' works at:

http://www.liquidinplastic.com/
http://www.vlemieuxphotography.com/
http://www.bradhornphotography.com/
http://archive.nevadaphotosource.com/
http://fieldingfotography.com/

Also, the prints and services to the right will be offered as a "Thank You" for your donations.


GALLERY OF IMAGES: http://www.kevincliffordphotography.com/donation-gallery/


****To specify your print order (metallic/Luster...) please send me a private message through:

kevincliffordphotography (at) gmail (dot) com
OR
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Kevin-Clifford-Photography/220711814624816

Please include your name, number, finish and what you ordered****

The Impact

Unfortunately, I would have to put off my surgery until it's a medical emergency. I'm trying to get this done before it comes to that.
Here is some information about hernias and a glimpse on what I have to deal with:
http://bodyandhealth.canada.com/channel_conditi...

What We Need & What You Get

Surgery is the best option at this stage and should be performed immediately.  Due to the events in Japan and having to return home on little to nothing, my ultimate goal is to be able to raise enough money ($5,500 upfront) to complete this surgery as soon as possible.  

As a "Thank you" for your donations, you will receive the prints or services on the right side of the page.


Photo information:


GALLERY OF IMAGES: http://www.kevincliffordphotography.com/donation-gallery/


* You can choose between Matte, Luster and Metallic finishes for the photos.


* Panoramas are ONLY available for the larger prints (12x18 and up) due to their extreme width.


* All photos are optimized for professional prints by professional photographers. No other crops or adjustments will be made. However, some computer resolutions will crop or stretch the photos because the photos were shot and cropped in a different aspect.


* There is an additional shipping fee for International Orders.


* Copying, distributing and reprinting of photos are prohibited under the copyright law. 


****To specify your print order (metallic/Luster...) please send me a private message through:

kevincliffordphotography (at) gmail (dot) com
OR
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Kevin-Clifford-Photography/220711814624816

Please include your name, number, finish and what you ordered****


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with your friends and family. You will get some fabulous prints or services with your donations!
story_txt:
Final Message:I just wanted to say that I am humbly grateful for all of the donations recieved from family, friends and complete strangers. You have really touched my heart in so many ways. Even if I don't make the goal, I will keep what was donated and continue to save until I have enough to get my surgery (ie not going to splurge on new camera gear). I will also put a donation button on my site a few days after this fundraiser, just so if someone wishes to donate some extra cash, they will able to do so.Finally, thanks again to all my close friends for helping me out in so many ways. I could not have done it without you!Thank you again!-Kevin Clifford
********************************************************************************************

The Story
Hello, my name is Kevin Clifford. I recently returned from Japan where I had been teaching English to the local children. While there, I experienced a wonderful and unique culture. One major event that I loved was experiencing New Years with thousands of people at Tokyo Tower and seeing thousands of hope balloons launch into the air at once. Unfortunately, because of the frequent earthquakes, continued threats of tsunamis and nuclear meltdowns that were escalating in Japan, I was forced to return to the United States on short notice and on very limited funding.  I returned home with less than $200 to get my life started again. Shortly after coming back to Reno, Nevada, I was attempting to find a new job (that would supplement my photography) when I hurt myself.  Little did I know, a groin (Inguinal) hernia had been forming for quite some time before becoming enlarged and quite painful. Many people can deal with hernias for many years before surgery. However, some people need surgery sooner rather than later. A hernia can be a medical emergency if it gets too big, which can cut the circulation off in the area. If I were to get a job with benefits ASAP, I would have to wait at least 3 months before being covered on insurance. However the job market is less than stellar and with more jobs shedding benefits, I feel it would be difficult to get the surgery within a year.  Photography is my passion and I have done a several outlandish things to get "the shot," which include going into a wildfire with a fire crew and photographing as an adult cheetah ran towards me while un-caged. The gear doesn't matter…the people do. Even though I am willing to sell everything I own, I don't wish for it to come to that just yet. Further, I know that you could be donating to someone who has cancer, is homeless, etc, and someone with a hernia is often viewed as "less deserving." story:
Hi,

My name is Aisha. I'm a wife and a stay-at-home mother of 2 boys. I'm from the Philippines but living in America with my family.

My campaign is for my sister-in-law, Minchu. She needs to raise at least $35,000 for her kidney transplant. This is my second time campaigning for her. The first one, I only raise $45 and I am thankful for the people who gave. Here's something about my sister-in-law:

Minchu, 29, is also a wife and mother of two adorable kids, ages 6 & 7.  Although young, Minchu is suffering from kidney failure. She receives dialysis twice a week and is in need of a kidney transplant as soon as possible. Minchu wants more than anything to see her kids grow up and to take care of her family. Her kids need her and my brother needs her too. She is their rock. It would be devastating to see those kids grow up without their mom.

She has family members in the Philippines who are willing to donate their kidney, but the cost is simply enormous --especially for Filipinos who only earn several dollars per day. 

To raise funds in the Philippines is much more difficult compared to doing the same in America.

It simply isn't enough to be able to provide significant help. We ask that you please help us to save Minchu's life by giving what you can. I promise you that your money will go only towards her medical expenses. Please help me by praying and sharing her story with everyone you know!

You can give any amount you'd like since someone brought this to my attention. The perks are just for anyone who would like to give an exact amount and we want to just be able to thank you with something.

Thank you for taking the time to read this campaign for Minchu.
