story:
TODAY IS THE DAY WHERE GREEN CLEANERS ACTUALLY BECOME GOOD

Introducing cleancult, household green cleaning products designed to fix ineffective green cleaning brands, challenge oil-based chemical cleaners on the market today, and reinvent how we see “green”. Designed in Puerto Rico and made in the USA, cleancult is introducing green cleaners that actually clean. So, why green cleaners you might ask...well turns out, cleaning in the US is in a bad state! 

According to the NYT, "Many Americans assume that the chemicals in their shampoos, detergents, and other consumer products have been thoroughly tested and proved to be safe. This assumption is Wrong". Unlike Pharmaceuticals or pesticides, industrial chemicals DO NOT have to be tested before they are put on the market.

The European Union and Canada have banned upward of 1,300 chemical ingredients in personal care products due to evidence of health hazards, but with its limited powers, the FDA has banned only 11 to date. With 53% of Americans overdoing their machine and an average 3% of the weight of your clothes coming from leftover laundry detergent, all of these chemicals are going into your clothes, on your skin, and into the environment! 

 

People are starting to realize this reality, but there simply aren’t enough alternatives. According to Nielsen, 93% of millennials say want to switch to natural products and 71% even say that they’re willing to spend more for it but this simply hasn’t happened. The facts are that only 3% of the total cleaning market is natural green cleaners, but why you may ask …

We set out to make cleancult different from other green cleaning brands. By supporting this campaign, you’re helping these 5 revolutionary cleaning products come to life. Each perk on the right contains a different cleaning plan that contains the below five products. Each product has been rigorously tested, experimentally innovated, and has been designed in Puerto Rico and made in the USA.

 

By backing cleancult, you will receive each of the products above, delivered directly to your door. Need to pause the product shipment, no problem! You will have complete control to change dates, reorganize the product mix, and make it fit your schedule. After the campaign ends, you will be asked to register on cleancult.com and then can mix and match the products as you see fit. 

Cleancult was designed to close the cleaning gap between traditional green products and toxic conventional cleaners giving you true clean which actually works and smells great. So, we're making it super easy, and cheap to make this reality come true. 

 

That’s why we, Puerto Ricans and Boulderites, combined to create green cleaners that actually work. So, do they actually work? Well, according to our many customer reviews, yes, they do! 

 

 


 

1. The Science of Puerto Rico!
Most people don’t know that Puerto Rico used to be home to over 65% of the worlds pharmaceutical companies! Then, in the early 2000s, due to a change in tax policy, most of these companies were forced to leave Puerto Rico. What was left was incredible scientists, labs, and universities which is why you can use the 100% non-toxic products here today.

2. Made in The USA!
Some green cleaning companies manufacture in China. What that means is less ingredient oversight and a potential to have some really questionable ingredients in the products you use in your home and on your body. Cleancult is made here in beautiful New York and Vermont which gives us complete control of the entire supply chain and innovation.

3. The Power of the Coconut
Some of our products use a special version of coconut oil that is incredibly astringent and is not adopted by the big corporates because of the cost! We’ve teamed up with a small producer in Vermont that helps us deliver this ingredient that actually cleans dirt and grime while being non-toxic for you and your family.

4. Natural Ingredients
Many other cleaners on the market are made from petrochemicals which are derived from...oil. That means they are often not biodegradable and support some of the biggest polluters in the world! Our cleaners are made of natural and mineral ingredients which means a safer and better clean for you and the world.

5. Delivered Whenever You Need
Rather than having to shop at the store, your cleaning products will be delivered to you how you like, when you like! After the campaign is closed, your profile will automatically be added to our website, cleancult.com. From there, you can edit how frequent your orders will ship.

6. Our Commitment to Puerto Rico
By having our headquarters in the USA and donating 1 load of laundry detergent for every load that you buy, we’re committed to Puerto Rico and to help rebuild the island. So far, we have donated over 100,000 loads of laundry detergent!

7. No Waste! 
Today, over 53% of Americans drastically overdose their clothes and machines. This overdosing goes straight to our streams and right onto our skin. Now, on average, 3% of the weight of our clothes is leftover laundry detergent has yet to be washed out. Our single dose dishwashing and laundry pacs mean you don’t have to worry about overdosing.

8. No More “Cleaning Graveyard”
We choose not to sell gigantic tubs of our products to avoid the “cleaning graveyard” underneath your sink. A right-sized cleaner will be delivered as often as you want, directly to your door. Say hooray to an actually clutter-free apartment and home! So, I get that it's awesome, but what's the science to it? 


Not many people know that Puerto Rico actually used to be home to 60% of the world's pharmaceutical companies. Until, changes in U.S policy forced most companies to leave the island in the early 2000's. This left behind a treasure trove of talented scientists, engineers, and top of the line laboratories. We moved to Puerto Rico and partnered with these incredible scientists, that aren't owned by the big chemical companies, and laboratories to create a proprietary formula that supercharges Coconut Oil into a whole new type of cleaner. It's harsher on tough stains like grease, blood, dirt, and wine. You know, all those super tough stains green cleaners won't even go near.

By designing our products in Puerto Rico and partnering with a leading chemical engineering university, we are able to ensure innovation, quality, and safety by operating the entire supply chain. From working with surfactant molecules to mixing the soap in our apartment, we’ve done it all. That means we can finally make green...mean. Watch out dirt.

Why We Started Cleancult
When we started cleancult, we saw a problem. People we worked with, talked with, and interviewed thought they needed to compromise when they purchased responsibly made, “green” products. Current statistics claim that over, 90% of millennials want to go green, but that simply hasn’t happened. Green cleaning has grown half as fast as petroleum based cleaners (yuck!). We call this the “cleaning gap” and wanted to change it.
Our goal is to close this “cleaning gap” and demonstrate to people that green cleaning can be mean! From our research, we know that this is part phycology and part chemistry and our goal is to solve them both. We set out to design cleaners that redefine green clean from the delivery to the packaging and all the way to the actual clean. We think we succeeded.

Our Mission
Our goal is to inspire and attract the next generation of responsible purchasing by designing responsible products and experiences with which you don’t have to compromise. We are not owned by a big corporation trying to “greenwash” but are instead trying to change the status quo. We believe that by basing ourselves in a strong community, listening to our customers, and trying to be leaders and not followers, we can use cleaners as a tool for change in your life... and in your bathroom;)

 

Ryan Lupberger | CEO
Ryan Lupberger has had a lifelong passion for building responsible brands and social movements. He’s worked at the Unreasonable Institute, The Lewis Institute for Social Innovation, and the CPG company, Think-Board, amongst others. He’s been featured as an American Express Changemaker and in 2017 was selected to give a TEDx titled “Why Millennials Why Millennials are Done With Green Brands and Why It Matters”. He’s also a contributor for Conscious Company Media and want to improve efficacy of social entrepreneurship by advocating that positioning excellence first, then impact second will make a more meaningful, lasting impact.

Zachary Bedrosian | CTO
Zachary Bedrosian was a key developer and designer at Learning Ally, the world's largest non profit technology company focusing on dyslexia and learning disabilities. During his time there, he saw the need for combining design, technology, and “good” business and decided to do something about it. After winning the IDG Boston award for Excellence in Technology, Zachary took his web development and design skills to the antiquated cleaning industry to help close the gap between good products and good design and to help inspire the next generation of responsible purchasing.

Carlos Pinzon | Director of R&D
Carlos Pinzon is an engineer on a mission. He has 10+ years of experience working in the pharmaceutical industry and on projects sponsored by the National Science Foundation, holds PhD from University of Puerto Rico-Mayaguez in chemistry and rheology, and is a key stakeholder in the R&D community in Puerto Rico. He’s experienced in bringing innovation to the pharma industry and is now re-energizing and reimagining the green cleaning industry.

And Others
Cleancult is also supported by a crack team of Puerto Ricans like Luis Santiago and Claudia Gerena. We would not have been able to produce cleancult without the help of our awesome team of freelancers, friends, and advisors.

 

What are the ingredients in Cleancult?
Great question! All of our ingredients are listed on our packaging and the full list can be found on our website at cleancult.com. When we say full list, we mean three or four ingredients for each product because yeah, these products rock...without the long chemical names. 

Will I be able to customize my plan?
Yes, 100%! After the campaign closes, your profile will automatically be added to cleancult.com. From there, you’ll be able to change your plan, switch your cleaners based on the plan you selected, and change your shipment date once you get your activation email.

Where are the products made?
Our all purpose cleaner and liquid dish soap is made in Vermont. Our dryer sheets, dish pacs, and laundry pacs are all made in NY. Our headquarters is, however, in Puerto Rico with some of the best scientists in the world!

When will I be able to start receiving my amazing cleancult cleaning products?
You will receive an email to activate your membership 48-72 hours after the campaign closes. From then, your products will ship 4 to 8 weeks after the campaign closes and you’ll be able to set your delivery frequency schedule.

Is cleancult a subscription box company? Will I get a box with your products every month?
Nope! You can shop on our site cleancult.com and choose any products you like and have them delivered at any time. You just won’t get the amazing Indiegogo launch discount.

Why aren’t your products verified as EPA Safer Choice?
Great question! They will be. We’ve used all ingredients approved as EPA Safer choice options, but our brand is so new that we have yet get approved. The same goes with EWG. We’ll hopefully be listed on the site later this year.

What is the difference between getting a membership on Indiegogo versus buying it on your website?
Everyone else after this Indiegogo will purchase our products at market price. With the support of our launch, you are getting over a 65% discount! Also, we won’t start selling on our site until later in the year.

How does shipping work?
For US shipping, the shipping is included in the Indiegogo perk costs. Wow, what a bargain! For international shipping, it depends on the size and location.

Do you test products on animals?
No, we never do. All of our products are 100% cruelty-free.
story_txt:
TODAY IS THE DAY WHERE GREEN CLEANERS ACTUALLY BECOME GOOD 
Introducing cleancult, household green cleaning products designed to fix ineffective green cleaning brands, challenge oil-based chemical cleaners on the market today, and reinvent how we see “green”. Designed in Puerto Rico and made in the USA, cleancult is introducing green cleaners that actually clean. So, why green cleaners you might ask...well turns out, cleaning in the US is in a bad state! According to the NYT, "Many Americans assume that the chemicals in their shampoos, detergents, and other consumer products have been thoroughly tested and proved to be safe. This assumption is Wrong". Unlike Pharmaceuticals or pesticides, industrial chemicals DO NOT have to be tested before they are put on the market.The European Union and Canada have banned upward of 1,300 chemical ingredients in personal care products due to evidence of health hazards, but with its limited powers, the FDA has banned only 11 to date. With 53% of Americans overdoing their machine and an average 3% of the weight of your clothes coming from leftover laundry detergent, all of these chemicals are going into your clothes, on your skin, and into the environment!  People are starting to realize this reality, but there simply aren’t enough alternatives. According to Nielsen, 93% of millennials say want to switch to natural products and 71% even say that they’re willing to spend more for it but this simply hasn’t happened. The facts are that only 3% of the total cleaning market is natural green cleaners, but why you may ask …We set out to make cleancult different from other green cleaning brands. By supporting this campaign, you’re helping these 5 revolutionary cleaning products come to life. Each perk on the right contains a different cleaning plan that contains the below five products. Each product has been rigorously tested, experimentally innovated, and has been designed in Puerto Rico and made in the USA. By backing cleancult, you will receive each of the products above, delivered directly to your door. Need to pause the product shipment, no problem! You will have complete control to change dates, reorganize the product mix, and make it fit your schedule. After the campaign ends, you will be asked to register on cleancult.com and then can mix and match the products as you see fit. Cleancult was designed to close the cleaning gap between traditional green products and toxic conventional cleaners giving you true clean which actually works and smells great. So, we're making it super easy, and cheap to make this reality come true.  That’s why we, Puerto Ricans and Boulderites, combined to create green cleaners that actually work. So, do they actually work? Well, according to our many customer reviews, yes, they do!    1. The Science of Puerto Rico! Most people don’t know that Puerto Rico used to be home to over 65% of the worlds pharmaceutical companies! Then, in the early 2000s, due to a change in tax policy, most of these companies were forced to leave Puerto Rico. What was left was incredible scientists, labs, and universities which is why you can use the 100% non-toxic products here today.2. Made in The USA! Some green cleaning companies manufacture in China. What that means is less ingredient oversight and a potential to have some really questionable ingredients in the products you use in your home and on your body. Cleancult is made here in beautiful New York and Vermont which gives us complete control of the entire supply chain and innovation.3. The Power of the CoconutSome of our products use a special version of coconut oil that is incredibly astringent and is not adopted by the big corporates because of the cost! We’ve teamed up with a small producer in Vermont that helps us deliver this ingredient that actually cleans dirt and grime while being non-toxic for you and your family.4. Natural IngredientsMany other cleaners on the market are made from petrochemicals which are derived from...oil. That means they are often not biodegradable and support some of the biggest polluters in the world! Our cleaners are made of natural and mineral ingredients which means a safer and better clean for you and the world.5. Delivered Whenever You NeedRather than having to shop at the store, your cleaning products will be delivered to you how you like, when you like! After the campaign is closed, your profile will automatically be added to our website, cleancult.com. From there, you can edit how frequent your orders will ship.6. Our Commitment to Puerto RicoBy having our headquarters in the USA and donating 1 load of laundry detergent for every load that you buy, we’re committed to Puerto Rico and to help rebuild the island. So far, we have donated over 100,000 loads of laundry detergent!7. No Waste! Today, over 53% of Americans drastically overdose their clothes and machines. This overdosing goes straight to our streams and right onto our skin. Now, on average, 3% of the weight of our clothes is leftover laundry detergent has yet to be washed out. Our single dose dishwashing and laundry pacs mean you don’t have to worry about overdosing.8. No More “Cleaning Graveyard”We choose not to sell gigantic tubs of our products to avoid the “cleaning graveyard” underneath your sink. A right-sized cleaner will be delivered as often as you want, directly to your door. Say hooray to an actually clutter-free apartment and home! So, I get that it's awesome, but what's the science to it? Not many people know that Puerto Rico actually used to be home to 60% of the world's pharmaceutical companies. Until, changes in U.S policy forced most companies to leave the island in the early 2000's. This left behind a treasure trove of talented scientists, engineers, and top of the line laboratories. We moved to Puerto Rico and partnered with these incredible scientists, that aren't owned by the big chemical companies, and laboratories to create a proprietary formula that supercharges Coconut Oil into a whole new type of cleaner. It's harsher on tough stains like grease, blood, dirt, and wine. You know, all those super tough stains green cleaners won't even go near.By designing our products in Puerto Rico and partnering with a leading chemical engineering university, we are able to ensure innovation, quality, and safety by operating the entire supply chain. From working with surfactant molecules to mixing the soap in our apartment, we’ve done it all. That means we can finally make green...mean. Watch out dirt.Why We Started CleancultWhen we started cleancult, we saw a problem. People we worked with, talked with, and interviewed thought they needed to compromise when they purchased responsibly made, “green” products. Current statistics claim that over, 90% of millennials want to go green, but that simply hasn’t happened. Green cleaning has grown half as fast as petroleum based cleaners (yuck!). We call this the “cleaning gap” and wanted to change it.Our goal is to close this “cleaning gap” and demonstrate to people that green cleaning can be mean! From our research, we know that this is part phycology and part chemistry and our goal is to solve them both. We set out to design cleaners that redefine green clean from the delivery to the packaging and all the way to the actual clean. We think we succeeded.Our MissionOur goal is to inspire and attract the next generation of responsible purchasing by designing responsible products and experiences with which you don’t have to compromise. We are not owned by a big corporation trying to “greenwash” but are instead trying to change the status quo. We believe that by basing ourselves in a strong community, listening to our customers, and trying to be leaders and not followers, we can use cleaners as a tool for change in your life... and in your bathroom;) Ryan Lupberger | CEORyan Lupberger has had a lifelong passion for building responsible brands and social movements. He’s worked at the Unreasonable Institute, The Lewis Institute for Social Innovation, and the CPG company, Think-Board, amongst others. He’s been featured as an American Express Changemaker and in 2017 was selected to give a TEDx titled “Why Millennials Why Millennials are Done With Green Brands and Why It Matters”. He’s also a contributor for Conscious Company Media and want to improve efficacy of social entrepreneurship by advocating that positioning excellence first, then impact second will make a more meaningful, lasting impact.Zachary Bedrosian | CTOZachary Bedrosian was a key developer and designer at Learning Ally, the world's largest non profit technology company focusing on dyslexia and learning disabilities. During his time there, he saw the need for combining design, technology, and “good” business and decided to do something about it. After winning the IDG Boston award for Excellence in Technology, Zachary took his web development and design skills to the antiquated cleaning industry to help close the gap between good products and good design and to help inspire the next generation of responsible purchasing.Carlos Pinzon | Director of R&D Carlos Pinzon is an engineer on a mission. He has 10+ years of experience working in the pharmaceutical industry and on projects sponsored by the National Science Foundation, holds PhD from University of Puerto Rico-Mayaguez in chemistry and rheology, and is a key stakeholder in the R&D community in Puerto Rico. He’s experienced in bringing innovation to the pharma industry and is now re-energizing and reimagining the green cleaning industry.And OthersCleancult is also supported by a crack team of Puerto Ricans like Luis Santiago and Claudia Gerena. We would not have been able to produce cleancult without the help of our awesome team of freelancers, friends, and advisors. What are the ingredients in Cleancult? Great question! All of our ingredients are listed on our packaging and the full list can be found on our website at cleancult.com. When we say full list, we mean three or four ingredients for each product because yeah, these products rock...without the long chemical names. Will I be able to customize my plan? Yes, 100%! After the campaign closes, your profile will automatically be added to cleancult.com. From there, you’ll be able to change your plan, switch your cleaners based on the plan you selected, and change your shipment date once you get your activation email.Where are the products made?Our all purpose cleaner and liquid dish soap is made in Vermont. Our dryer sheets, dish pacs, and laundry pacs are all made in NY. Our headquarters is, however, in Puerto Rico with some of the best scientists in the world!When will I be able to start receiving my amazing cleancult cleaning products? You will receive an email to activate your membership 48-72 hours after the campaign closes. From then, your products will ship 4 to 8 weeks after the campaign closes and you’ll be able to set your delivery frequency schedule.Is cleancult a subscription box company? You just won’t get the amazing Indiegogo launch discount.Why aren’t your products verified as EPA Safer Choice? Great question! They will be. We’ve used all ingredients approved as EPA Safer choice options, but our brand is so new that we have yet get approved. The same goes with EWG. We’ll hopefully be listed on the site later this year.What is the difference between getting a membership on Indiegogo versus buying it on your website? Everyone else after this Indiegogo will purchase our products at market price. With the support of our launch, you are getting over a 65% discount! Also, we won’t start selling on our site until later in the year.How does shipping work?For US shipping, the shipping is included in the Indiegogo perk costs. Wow, what a bargain! For international shipping, it depends on the size and location.Do you test products on animals?No, we never do. All of our products are 100% cruelty-free.

story:
Ever wonder why 6 of the 7 most common sports related injuries involve the lower body? Or why so many people have foot problems these days? It's simple...SHOES.

No matter what sport or recreational activity you partake in, your feet and ankles are paramount to performance. Building stronger feet and ankles in the weight room will translate to the court or field of play. 

Join us on our journey of breaking from the traditional and into Pedestals for your training sessions. Improve performance and mitigate injury. 

We are proudly made, manufactured, and shipped in the U.S.A.

Our goal is to take our 2.0's into mass production and disrupt the footwear industry. Your pledges and trust on Indiegogo will help us achieve that.

 

 

 

Get Your Project Funded Today!

Get Cash Back on the Projects You Love!

Interested in writing about us and our mission? Click HERE to download our press kit. Feel free to email us directly at hello@pedestalfootwear.com if you have any other questions. We look forward to hearing from you. 

Patent-pending design. 

Thank you for backing us!

story:
Ever wondered why today's ergonomic armrests look like WW2 rifle stands?

We have. 

That's why we built Mouzen. An ergonomic armrest that combines the best of ergonomics with world-class engineering and beautiful design.

We spend most of our days working on computers. While technology has gone a long way since the early days, the mechanics of how we use the mouse and keyboard hasn't changed that much.

Only now are we learning how long-term usage and continuous repetitions can be associated with various computer-related disorders and injuries later in life.

 

With its ErgoFlow™ mechanism, it allows you to move freely and comfortably in all directions, supporting your arm in a natural state and forcing you to maintain an upright posture.

 

While most armrests require a 10-page manual to install and use, Mouzen is a simple and intuitive product that’s super easy to install. With an innovative single-mechanism lock clamp, Mouzen is ready to use in just 6 seconds. 

 

It works great on almost all surfaces and is suitable for desks of thickness 0.2″ (0.5 cm) – 2.1″ (5.5 cm). Every Mouzen comes with a hex key that will allow you to lock it securely on your desk.

Thanks to the innovative ErgoFlow™ mechanism, Mouzen can hold up to 50 lbs (21 kg) of load, without losing any movement properties. The mechanism has multiple shock absorbers and silencers built in, making it the most smooth and silent ergonomic armrest on the market. 

 

 

Mouzen's features create a healthier, stress- and tension-free working and gaming environment. Come out of your workflow cool, calm and collected.

MOUZEN IN ACTION

Big thanks to SoldierKnowsBest for taking the time and reviewing our Mouzen armrest!

Mouzen was founded by Gasper Kumprej, a serial entrepreneur and innovator, who has experienced the problems of working behind the desk all day long first-hand. Gasper started working with his father Roberth and engineering professor Jure Krof to find the best theoretic solution to the problem. Matej Lorenci joined the team as the materials and injection molding specialist, also providing production capacities with his company Plastika LVP.

 

EVOLUTION OF MOUZEN ERGONOMIC ARMREST

 

The Mouzen ergonomic armrest has been in development for three years and has gone through countless reiterations. It's now in its 7th prototype form and probably not the last one, as we're constantly trying to improve it—and we're especially fond of all feedback we get from the community.

(First wooden version)

(Benjamin Koren's final design)

 

Risks and challenges

We're on a mission to eliminate the risk of computer-related injuries. Other than that, there's little risk involved with this project.

The Mouzen idea and product have been in the making for the last 3 years, with 100+ beta testers and numerous supporters from the local community. The team behind Mouzen has a significant industry track record, ranging from ergonomics to in-house plastics production (Plastika LVP), and also includes complete production capabilities for all future Mouzen units.

As the company is being successfully bootstrapped by the founders from day one, most of the acquired funds will go into a new industrial solution for plastic injection that will lower the production cost and allow us to produce more than one unit per hour.

Thank you for your support and here's to a great future together!

Gasper and team Mouzen

story:
Order now your Alinker on www.thealinker.com

A radically different "mobility aid"

What is so radically different about the Alinker? Watch the TEDx talk Barbara Alink recently did about the design process and vision behind the Alinker.

Barbara designed the Alinker for the experience of the user and instead of approaching the functional requirements for the physical disability, her design premise for the Alinker was that it needed to be cool, so cool that the user would love to use it. So cool that the user would feel proud and be happy, and ultimately so cool that it would overcome the discomfort that other people have with the disability.

On the Alinker you can be upright and actively moving, be at eye-level, have your hands free, have no stress on the lower limbs, sit with good posture, be stable and feel safe.  

As seen on

Changing Lives

Our Mission

The Alinker was introduced to the Dutch market after a crowdfunding campaign in 2015. There is now a loyal customer base in the Netherlands, full of users and partners who love to share with us what they can do, now that they have an Alinker. Whether it’s being able to walk their dog everyday, or participate in a 20k walk, the Alinker allows people to live their lives, fully and happy.

Our mission is to create revolutionary solutions for people who want to live an active life, regardless of physical challenges. Our goal is to make it as easy and fun as possible for people to stay physically active, socially connected, and emotionally engaged in the community.

We think the Alinker can change the world, and we need your help.

"Do what you’re passionate about and take care of each other! Don’t let anything stand in your way"
- Barbara Alink

Our Story

Barbara Alink is a Dutch designer, architect, humanitarian, and inventor of the Alinker, who now lives in Canada.

The Alinker story started with a comment of Barbara’s aging mother- Antonia Esman. While passing some elderly people with walkers and scooters, she said: "over my dead body will I ever use one of those!”. Barbara set out to design something better for her mum, but started realizing that what she set out to design needed to become a vehicle for social change, challenging our assumptions about people with disabilities.

"I never cared to be cool, until I was not cool anymore."
- John Perry Barlow

Do what you love, no matter what

Conventional designs aim to transport the user from point A to point B, but neglect the physical, social, and emotional well-being of the individual.

Whether you are just getting older, feeling chronic aches and pains, or recovering from an injury, you probably want to keep living your life.

Introducing the Alinker

The Alinker is designed for people with mobility challenges or limitations who want to stay active no matter what. Most us of us enjoy physical exercise, social outings, and being included and treated like everyone else.

"It may sound dramatic, but the moment I got on the Alinker, my life changed...I have my legs back"
- Joe

Benefits of the Alinker

Physical Activity

  • Allows for low-impact, strength-building physical exercise
  • Allows for travel across longer distances with less fatigue
  • Lightweight, foldable frame for easy transport

Social Inclusion

  • User sits upright, at eye-level with their companions
  • Allows for independent operation without assistance
  • Allows users to feel equal & included

Emotional Well-Being

  • Instills hope & builds confidence
  • Improves self-image
  • Free to live an activity and social life

3 Ways to Help

Order

Get an Alinker directly through the campaign. Alinkers are available in Small, Medium, or Large based on height. A limited number of Alinkers is available for delivery as early as June 2016, as well as exclusive custom campaign deals. (Perks 4-11)

Contribute

Contribute to an Alinker for someone else. Nominate someone who needs an Alinker, email us at win@thealinker.com with the nominee's name, contact info, and why they deserve to win an Alinker. You can make multiple contributions. (Perks 1-3)

Share

Spread the word and share this project with your friends; Together we'll change the world!

Goal & Stretch Goals

We reached this goal in the first 24 hours! Thank you!

We also reached this goal, we are so thrilled! We have already shipped Alinkers and are ordering more Small Alinkers! We will announce some amazing events where we will participate, thanks to you we can think further! Thank you!

Now, we extended the campaign until the 20th of June! When we reach $300K it will allow us to set up for larger production runs and develop custom accessories like baskets & carry-on bags for the Alinker. Imagine a custom-made Alinker specific basket perfectly aligned with the frame lines of the Alinker...

It would be a dream when you help us reach this goal. When we do, it allows us to start the development of the Alinker for children! Imagine! We receive many emails from parents telling us how perfect the Alinker would be for their kids who hate their walking aid. Here is an example of one of these emails.

"My sweet girl cannot walk or stand independently, she uses a walker and a wheelchair for long distances. She hates her walker and asks Santa to take it away...She would LOVE LOVE LOVE a run bike like this!"

Which Size Alinker Do I Need?

for specifications see website http://www.thealinker.com/specifications/

Perks

$20

Nominate someone to be entered into a draw to win an Alinker + Thank you note from inventor.

$90

Nominate someone to be entered into a draw to win an Alinker + Limited edition Alinker T-shirt

$180

Receive a photobook of the Alinker's design history. This book, signed by the inventor, shows early sketches, photos of all stages, and describes the inventor's design process, including surprising details that you might have not expected!

$350

Nominate someone to be entered into a draw to win an Alinker + Skype call with the inventor, Barbara Alink.

$1000 down-payment only

DUE TO HIGH DEMAND and SOLD OUT FIRST RUNS!

Alinkers of the second run! Plus Alinker T-shirt. 
Delivery date of another 9 Small, 40 Medium and 12 Large Alinkers can actually be delivered by the end of August!!!  For further Alinker orders we are planning a consecutive production run.  This is a down-payment only. Before they arrive you will receive the invoice for the remaining payment of $977 + shipping within USA or Canada

$1977 + Shipping

Be one of the first people to ever use an Alinker in North America + get a limited edition Alinker T-shirt!
*Limited quantities available. Estimated delivery: June 2016

$5000

With sponsoring  this, your organization / company gets great exposure! Your name and logo will be mentioned in all the press releases, at three events including the VIP/Media Reception, the LA Fashion Week show on Oct. 2 and at the International PWD Fashion Conference, Oct. 3 and 4, as well as during the Mercedes-Benz Fashion week in October the 17th October, on the websites of Bezgraniz Couture as well as the Alinker Inventions Ltd. They will be printed in the show programs and in the hand outs at these shows. You will also receive a graphic that you can add to your own website, showing that you support People With Disabilities.

Have a look at how amazing these shows are:

https://youtu.be/msLOeN7wOmM

"The world needs more compassionate entrepreneurs like Barbara creating innovative solutions like the Alinker. SheEO is behind her 100%."
- Vicki Saunders, Founder of SheEO

Check out Barbara's interview on CBC Vancouver!


Alinkers on the runway!

We are invited to participate on the run way in the fashion show of Bezgraniz Couture (fashion without borders) during the L A Fashion week the 2nd October. Two Alinkers will be used by models with Cerebral Palsy. On the 21-22nd October, the Alinkers are on the runway of the Bezgraniz fashion show at the Mercedes Benz Fashion week in Moscow!  We have added a very special perk for sponsors! You can sponsor these incredible run way events and get exposure with your company or organization. If you want more information about the event and sponsorship, send us an email info@thealinker.com


Giving Back

Barbara spent a significant amount of time living abroad and working in countries like Afghanistan, building schools for children. Her experiences of living in foreign countries opened her eyes to the significance of community participation and social inclusion. As such, the Alinker is committed to donating 1 out of every 100 Alinkers to people affected by landmines, starting with veterans, wounded warriors.


Our Partners

  
The Alinker partners with for all Alinker merchandise. Product with purpose.

Campaign Powered by Radish Marketing

Timeline

Icons made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com is licensed by CC BY 3.0

Our Mission
The Alinker was introduced to the Dutch market after a crowdfunding campaign in 2015. There is now a loyal customer base in the Netherlands, full of users and partners who love to share with us what they can do, now that they have an Alinker. Whether it’s being able to walk their dog everyday, or participate in a 20k walk, the Alinker allows people to live their lives, fully and happy.
Our mission is to create revolutionary solutions for people who want to live an active life, regardless of physical challenges. Our goal is to make it as easy and fun as possible for people to stay physically active, socially connected, and emotionally engaged in the community.
We think the Alinker can change the world, and we need your help.


"Do what you’re passionate about and take care of each other! Don’t let anything stand in your way" - Barbara Alink





Our Story
Barbara Alink is a Dutch designer, architect, humanitarian, and inventor of the Alinker, who now lives in Canada.
The Alinker story started with a comment of Barbara’s aging mother- Antonia Esman. While passing some elderly people with walkers and scooters, she said: "over my dead body will I ever use one of those!”. Barbara set out to design something better for her mum, but started realizing that what she set out to design needed to become a vehicle for social change, challenging our assumptions about people with disabilities.






"I never cared to be cool, until I was not cool anymore." - John Perry Barlow



Do what you love, no matter what
Conventional designs aim to transport the user from point A to point B, but neglect the physical, social, and emotional well-being of the individual.
Whether you are just getting older, feeling chronic aches and pains, or recovering from an injury, you probably want to keep living your life.



Introducing the Alinker
The Alinker is designed for people with mobility challenges or limitations who want to stay active no matter what. Most us of us enjoy physical exercise, social outings, and being included and treated like everyone else.





"It may sound dramatic, but the moment I got on the Alinker, my life changed...I have my legs back" - Joe


Benefits of the Alinker

Physical Activity

Allows for low-impact, strength-building physical exercise
Allows for travel across longer distances with less fatigue
Lightweight, foldable frame for easy transport



Social Inclusion

User sits upright, at eye-level with their companions
Allows for independent operation without assistance
Allows users to feel equal & included



Emotional Well-Being

Instills hope & builds confidence
Improves self-image
Free to live an activity and social life



3 Ways to Help


OrderGet an Alinker directly through the campaign. Alinkers are available in Small, Medium, or Large based on height. A limited number of Alinkers is available for delivery as early as June 2016, as well as exclusive custom campaign deals. (Perks 4-11) 



Contribute
Contribute to an Alinker for someone else. Nominate someone who needs an
 Alinker, email us at win@thealinker.com with the nominee's name, 
contact info, and why they deserve to win an Alinker. You can make multiple contributions. (Perks 1-3) 


ShareSpread the word and share this project with your friends; Together we'll change the world!

Goal & Stretch Goals


We reached this goal in the first 24 hours! Thank you!



We also reached this goal, we are so thrilled! We have already shipped Alinkers and are ordering more Small Alinkers! We will announce some amazing events where we will participate, thanks to you we can think further! Thank you!




Now, we extended the campaign until the 20th of June! When we reach $300K it will allow us to set up for larger production runs and develop custom accessories like baskets & carry-on bags for the Alinker. Imagine a custom-made Alinker specific basket perfectly aligned with the frame lines of the Alinker...




It would be a dream when you help us reach this goal. When we do, it allows us to start the development of the Alinker for children! Imagine! We receive many emails from parents telling us how perfect the Alinker would be for their kids who hate their walking aid. Here is an example of one of these emails. 



"My sweet girl cannot walk or stand independently, she uses a walker and a wheelchair for long distances. She hates her walker and asks Santa to take it away...She would LOVE LOVE LOVE a run bike like this!"


Which Size Alinker Do I Need?

for specifications see website http://www.thealinker.com/specifications/

Perks

$20
Nominate someone to be entered into a draw to win an Alinker + Thank you note from inventor.


$90
Nominate someone to be entered into a draw to win an Alinker + Limited edition Alinker T-shirt


$180
Receive a photobook of the Alinker's design history. This book, signed by the inventor, shows early sketches, photos of all stages, and describes the inventor's design process, including surprising details that you might have not expected!


$350
Nominate someone to be entered into a draw to win an Alinker + Skype call with the inventor, Barbara Alink.


$1000 down-payment only


DUE TO HIGH DEMAND and SOLD OUT FIRST RUNS! 

Alinkers of the second run! Plus Alinker T-shirt.  Delivery date of another 9 Small, 40 Medium and 12 Large Alinkers can actually be delivered by the end of August!!!  For further Alinker orders we are planning a consecutive production run.  This is a down-payment only. Before they arrive you will receive the invoice for the remaining payment of $977 + shipping within USA or Canada





$1977 + Shipping
Be one of the first people to ever use an Alinker in North America + get a limited edition Alinker T-shirt! *Limited quantities available. Estimated delivery: June 2016



$5000
With sponsoring  this, your organization / company gets great exposure! Your name and logo 
will be mentioned in all the press releases, at three events including 
the VIP/Media Reception, the LA Fashion Week show on Oct. 2 and at the 
International PWD Fashion Conference, Oct. 3 and 4, as well as during the Mercedes-Benz Fashion week in October the 17th October, on the websites of 
Bezgraniz Couture as well as the Alinker Inventions Ltd. They will be 
printed in the show programs and in the hand outs at these shows. You 
will also receive a graphic that you can add to your own website, 
showing that you support People With Disabilities. 
Have a look at how amazing these shows are: 
https://youtu.be/msLOeN7wOmM




"The world needs more compassionate entrepreneurs like Barbara creating innovative solutions like the Alinker. SheEO is behind her 100%." - Vicki Saunders, Founder of SheEO



Check out Barbara's interview on CBC Vancouver!


Alinkers on the runway!

We are invited to participate on the run way in the fashion show of Bezgraniz Couture
 (fashion without borders) during the L A Fashion week the 2nd October. 
Two Alinkers will be used by models with Cerebral Palsy. On the 21-22nd 
October, the Alinkers are on the runway of the Bezgraniz fashion show at
 the Mercedes Benz Fashion week in Moscow!   We
 have added a very special perk for sponsors! You can sponsor these 
incredible run way events and get exposure with your company or 
organization. If you want more information about the event and 
sponsorship, send us an email info@thealinker.com


Giving Back
Barbara spent a significant amount of time living abroad and working in countries like Afghanistan, building schools for children. Her experiences of living in foreign countries opened her eyes to the significance of community participation and social inclusion. As such, the Alinker is committed to donating 1 out of every 100 Alinkers to people affected by landmines, starting with veterans, wounded warriors.

Our Partners





  







 



 The Alinker partners with  for all Alinker merchandise. Product with purpose.



Campaign Powered by Radish Marketing

Timeline

story:
Share Center

Own your knowledge and empower your future.

What is "Share Center"?

It is a free web tool to store and share ideas.

That helps you to understand and resolve problems.
That let you capture anything notes, contacts, references, work projects, research and more ...That let you access your content from popular web browsers.That helps you find everything faster.That helps you to share your content with friends and colleagues.

How it works? 

It works like a web file systems,  providing specialized features for organize and share your content.


Features

  • It provides a easy and efficient way to categorize and retrieve content.
  • It provides specialized features for real world concepts  Persons, Organizations, Projects, Commitments, Articles, Comments, Files...
  • It provides features for personal and group authoring and sharing.

Advantages


  • It helps you to keep all in one place organized for easy retrieval.
  • You can easy share your content with out the need to copy or email it.
  • You can build and share mind maps using real world concepts.
  • You can deploy "Share Center" on your own infrastructure.
  • You can pay for commercial support, consultant and hosting complementary services.

Benefits.

Each specialized container have been designed to support the best practices that we know can increase your productivity. For example Mind Mapping, Knowledge Management, Content and Commitment Management Practices. Our paper Share Center White Paper shows the details of our value generation goals.

If you want to see our current prototype please go to the gallery tab, here there are to links for quick access:  Commitment Management Preview and Mind Mapping preview.


How do we contribute to a better future?

Our effort is an open project with the goal of making this kind of tools and practices accessible and affordable for all.  We are convinced that knowledge management technologies can helps us to share our knowledge to improve our overall level of life. If you are not still convinced but interest please see the video of "What is innovation? on the gallery. Here is a link to it for quick access  What is innovation?

Who we are?

We are a group of  Open Knowledge advocates formed by information technologies professionals based in Mexico.  All of us have a well recognized experience working with Information technologies.

Diego is the technical leader of the project it is our expert in dealing with new and promising technologies.

Angel is one of our software architect in charge of meeting our performance goals.

Alma is our support leader, her roll is to ensure that we all are aligned with our members concerns.

Veronica Sanchez is our project manager with the responsability of taking all us thru all the stages of a project from planning to delivery .

How can you help?

The best way of helping is sharing. Even if you can't afford to support us with your hard earned cash, please help us spreading the word, tell your friends!, talk about it.

What we have and what we need?

For the last two years we have been worked on the development of our conceptual model and in a full scale working prototype. We have finished both them and we are ready for the next step, that is to transform our full size working prototype into a complete open source solution.

For this purpose we need your help to fund a full time four members team for a year, our funding goal is to obtain $160,000.00 USD

If we are not fully funded, we will still work on it. But it will take us more time to achieve our goals. 

What is our plan?

Our plan is to deliver a release candidate for February 2014.  And our first release for summer 2014.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q. What would I get (detailed)?

A FREE web tool that helps you manage personal and group information in order to generate knowledge and take decisions. That is multi user mindmap where all the information can be organized, classified, shared and easily accessed.

That provides:

  • A FREE open source GPL V 3.0 license to use it, share it and modify it.
  • Features  for realizing the main knowledge management activities: search, classify, produce and share.
  • Features to support real world concepts like : People, Organizations, Projects, Commitments, Comments and Articles.
  • Support for current main web browsers (as October 2013) Chrome, IE, Safari and Android (Including mobile versions).
  • A deployment option as a server appliance that may run on a desktop, laptop or in a cloud server.
  • Video tutorials and guides.
  • Availability of Commercial support, consultant and hosting services.

Q. Where is the code?

You can find our code at Sourceforge:  http://sourceforge.net/projects/sharecenter


Q. How can you enhance our performance and capabilities to understand and resolve problems?

We can improve them by providing tools that supports proven practices. Our paper Share Center White Paper shows the details of our value generation goals.

Q. Can I use Share Center on my Mac, Windows or Mobile device?

Share Center is being developed as a web application it may be used from one of following browsers: Chrome, Firefox and Internet Explorer. We will also support for the most used mobile browsers for Android and IOS.

The server part is a web application in java that currently run on Linux Ubuntu, other platforms may be include according our members needs and funding. The server will be distributed as an appliance that may run a virtual machine in your desktop or in a cloud server.

Q. What browsers will be supported?

Q. Can I access my Share Center remotely, even if it runs on localhost?

Much like any other self-hosted website, you can make your local "Share Center" accessible over the Internet by using port forwarding or a tunneling service like PageKite. Of course, you will have to run it on a machine that is usually switched on if you want frequent remote access.

Q. What technology does Share Center use?

Sharecenter is written in Java its foundations relies on various opensource projects like Tomcat, DB4O, Vaadin, Solr, Hadoop, AspectJ.

Q. Why do you chose this technologies?

We have make a substantial effort in selecting promising technologies with the potential of helping us to deal with complex problems with out loosing our way.
From the technical point of view our key contribution is to maintain a simple architecture that will allow us to focus in the "Knowledge Management" problems.

The paper Concept Framework  resumes our efforts regarding the technologies we are using.

Q. Why do you need $160,000 USD?

We need it to maintaining a full time 4 members team for a year in Mexico, considering the fees and expenses that we have planed to release a tested solution.

Q. What if you raise over $160,000 USD?

We will spend it wisely, using our members feedback in order to prioritize our efforts to ensure value generation. We already have a list of feature proposals for future releases. We will be very glad include your proposals and to eventually have the opportunity to work on them.

Q. Do you have more questions?

If you have more questions please contact us:
 at facebook: https://www.facebook.com/sharecenter
 by  e-mail sharecenter@openknowledge.mx
 at our home page  www.openknowledge.mx

story:
The best potty for newborn babies. Now even better.

A new and improved version of the discontinued EC top hat potty?
Oh yes.
Let me explain.

First, quick back story.

When I first started EC with my first baby, I had to wait 8 weeks to get my top hat potty, or baby potty bowl, in the mail. It was terrible.

But once I got it, I ordered another immediately. Because who knew how long you could get these?

And that's exactly the current situation.

No one manufactures the top hat potty anymore. Even those who did have a few are now completely sold out.

I'm going to solve that with The Baby Potty.

But who am I, you might be asking?

I'm Andrea Olson from Go Diaper Free (where I teach new parents Elimination Communication aka EC, and potty training for older babies), Tiny Undies (where I sell undies and training pants from 6 months up), and DiaperFreeBaby (the international non-profit for EC awareness).

Besides my 2 best-selling books, I've brought 3 physical products to market: a popular board book called Tiny Potty, Tiny Undies, and Tiny Trainers.

You are in good hands, potential backers. I've been known to bring a great product to market. :)

What is a top hat potty?

Top hat potties are convenient, discreet, and small. They are for 0-12 month (depending on the size of the baby!) babies. Great for newborn EC, pottying on the go, and nighttime EC.

Here's a quick vid on how to use a top hat potty with a small baby:

So, what are we gonna do about this potty shortage?

Let's get 'em made, but let's do it even better.

Introducing The Baby Potty.

It is better than the old model because it is recyclable, non-slip, and already comfortable.

  1. RECYCLABLE GOODNESS. I'm using recyclable, lightweight, flexible, BPA-free plastic on this round 2 of manufacturing. It is portable and smooth, in 4 lovely muted colors.
  2. NON-SLIP INGENUITY. I've added a very wide, oversized, natural rubber band to prevent slippage while holding the potty between your thighs...so no more spills of pee and poo onto your lap, the floor, the bed, your car, or your baby. (Ask me how I know.)
  3. A WARM AND COMFY SEAT. I'm including a potty cozy (liquid-repellant undyed fleece) to every potty. Because who likes a cold seat? Or extra cost? (Usually these are $9 extra.) Not me, my dear. And not your baby, I assure you.

The potty:

The colors:

The bottom:

What we need to make this a reality

I've already purchased the mold for $2500, done a few production tests, and placed a full first order for 4,000 potties. They are on a boat en route to the US of A, as we speak.

I estimate shipping out all final products to you by April 2018. This time around they are completely done. Now it's just a matter of placing the final payment when they arrive, and shipping them to you and your baby!

Manufacturing costs include:

  • making the mold $2500
  • first round of manufacturing $3000
  • manufacture of additional elements $1000
  • shipping and branding supplies $1000

I am raising funds through pre-orders for the remaining $5000 in costs.

But I need your help to make this a reality!

Please pre-order your Baby Potty today.

You can make sure everyone has long-term access to this ECing gem - which is integral to successfully potty a young baby - by backing this campaign and pre-ordering your Baby Potty today.

This potty helps the world by:

  • reducing the barriers to starting EC for parents worldwide (these potties make EC *so much* easier)
  • reducing diaper waste (ECed babies typically use less than 1/2 the diapers of non-ECed babies)
  • helping parents stick with EC because they now have the right tools (longevity!).

Here are some of the Perks I'm offering:

  • EC Stickers featuring the DiaperFreeBaby baby

  • The Baby Potty with rubber grip and undyed fleece potty cozy

  • 2-pack and 6-pack options

  • Book, Course, and all 3 Packages

  • A private 2-day in-person coach session with yours truly at your home, including all of the above.

 

Check out all the perks on this page and pre-order your potty - by purchasing a perk - today!

Other ways you can help

No matter what perk you choose, it would mean the world to me if you could please SHARE this campaign with your mama groups, your social networks, and your pals...it's only up for 7 days.

Thank you so much for your ongoing support and happy pottying!

xx

Go Diaper Free, Tiny Undies, and DiaperFreeBaby

Patent and trademark pending.

story:
The anatomy of the foot is incredibly complex, with as many as 20,000 nerve endings just in the sole! These are all interconnected with other vital organs of your body, so it is easy to imagine the negative impact that unsuitable insoles could have, not just on your feet but your whole wellbeing.

How do existing insoles actually cater to all of the different foot shapes? Unfortunately, the short answer is, they don't. You may see insoles that need to be cut with scissors to ensure "best fitment". You may also see memory foam insoles which typically quickly "bottom-out" because the foam's core structure is weak. Whilst having some kind of insole may be better than none, it is worth taking an extra step to find an insole that truly is optimal for your foot and make every second you spend on your feet better!

 

We are an active team that participate in a range of activities such as Running, Basketball, Soccer, Golf, Mountain-Biking, Motocross, Snowboarding and Hiking. We are familiar with the strains such strenuous activities impose on our bodies, and many start at the feet!. We knew from the beginning that the ideal insole had to be able to withstand the large amounts of pressure these kinds of activities put on one's feet and the rest of their body.

Our insoles are the product of 4 years of testing and engineering. When you buy a pair of Z-Liners here on Indiegogo, you're getting top quality, revolutionary insoles for only £19/$24. The reason for this; our insoles are made in our own factory, we are able to cut significant costs that other brands face. This allows us to cut the mark-up from our insoles entirely. This also lets us bring you the most recent technology in the insole market for half the price that you would normally see. If we used a 3rd party factory instead, the price of Z-Liners would double or even triple in some cases. Everything on our insole has been carefully considered. Our main concern is our supporters health and overall wellbeing. We use many distinct processes to create each pair of Z-Liners. More info on this below!

 

Our honeycomb design uses one of nature's strongest patterns to create an ideal footbed for performance and for your wellbeing. The strength of our HPE (High Performance Elastomer) material and ergonomic design allows the insole to actively adapt to your feet without compromising structural integrity and stability. This means you won't experience bottom-outs/flat spots. Z-liners hold their form under the most demanding times, giving an exceptional feeling of balance and grounded-ness. Balance is a crucial element to have in one's arsenal, as it is important in any activity we do, and the last thing you need letting you down is your insoles! 

Our insoles have been tested with different types of microorganisms and are proven to be effective at fighting them off (*please refer to test results further down). Have extra confidence in your Z-liners knowing that bacteria and microbes are being actively fought-off, even when you're not wearing them!

Z-Liners are friendly to our bodies and the environment as well. We use a unique manufacturing process which allows us to build our entire insole without using any harsh glues or bonding compounds. This means you don't have to worry about any foreign substances being absorbed into your skin and the environment after disposal. Also makes them the perfect pair to wear with your feet bare. You can even use them sock-less!

Go Commando With Z-Liners!

There are over 250,000 sweat glands in our feet, secreting up to a half-pint of sweat a day. Our breathable mesh fabric and honeycomb design allows for moisture to dissipate away from the foot and bring in airflow to help keep your feet as dry, cool and odor-free as possible. Also, being that there are no adhesives used, it gives even greater airflow by leaving the pores of the insole unobstructed by glue and other adhesive compounds. 

Added support that forms to your arch as your wear them, helping bring a more confident sense of balance and also helping reduce and remove pain in your lower extremities. Our robust honeycomb design and durable material provide ultimate shock absorbing properties and give your feet added rest by dispersing the hard impact throughout the insole, harnessing your whole foot rather than focusing stress on localized areas. 

We didn't just stop at using antimicrobial/antibacterial properties. We have gone above and beyond to make sure the Z-Liners could also withstand the harshness of being thrown in the wash and dryer for a few hours. If you soil them, don't worry about buying another pair, just toss them in the washing machine like you would with your clothes and garments. They'll come out fresh and clean! 

It's counter-intuitive to make an insole that is anything less than a precise fitment. Its our feet we're talking about here! If our feet aren't happy, we aren't either. This is why we made it a priority to make sure that our insoles were made in all sizes, even half sizes! No more cutting or trimming necessary! 

Currently, we are getting ready for our global launch. We recently had Z-liners in a small test market in the U.K. We were received positively and have over 100 reviews generated from our customer base. In our test release, we used different colors, we had beige, black, brown and orange. The insoles also had a different logo that we felt didn't do the insole its justice. We decided to create a new color scheme for our global release and also added highly reflective material to our new minimal logo placed under the heel. We had our eyes set on charcoal grey as it makes a perfect unisex color.

We are hoping that you can help reach our goal and potentially beyond! This will allow us to start shipping our insoles internationally in bulk for a reduced shipping price. More leaps and bounds to come!

(By independent institutions, Korea)

TEST VERSIONS:

FINAL VERSION:

Risks and challenges

Everything is on-track! Manufacturing is on schedule and we don't foresee any issues or delays to arise. We are also aware that the future sometimes brings surprises, but we will continue to stay on top of things and make updates whenever necessary.
story_txt: The anatomy of the foot is incredibly complex, with as many as 20,000 nerve endings just in the sole! These are all interconnected with other vital organs of your body, so it is easy to imagine the negative impact that unsuitable insoles could have, not just on your feet but your whole wellbeing.How do existing insoles actually cater to all of the different foot shapes? Unfortunately, the short answer is, they don't. You may see insoles that need to be cut with scissors to ensure "best fitment". You may also see memory foam insoles which typically quickly "bottom-out" because the foam's core structure is weak. Whilst having some kind of insole may be better than none, it is worth taking an extra step to find an insole that truly is optimal for your foot and make every second you spend on your feet better! We are an active team that participate in a range of activities such as Running, Basketball, Soccer, Golf, Mountain-Biking, Motocross, Snowboarding and Hiking. We are familiar with the strains such strenuous activities impose on our bodies, and many start at the feet!. We knew from the beginning that the ideal insole had to be able to withstand the large amounts of pressure these kinds of activities put on one's feet and the rest of their body.Our insoles are the product of 4 years of testing and engineering. When you buy a pair of Z-Liners here on Indiegogo, you're getting top quality, revolutionary insoles for only £19/$24. The reason for this; our insoles are made in our own factory, we are able to cut significant costs that other brands face. This allows us to cut the mark-up from our insoles entirely. This also lets us bring you the most recent technology in the insole market for half the price that you would normally see. If we used a 3rd party factory instead, the price of Z-Liners would double or even triple in some cases. Everything on our insole has been carefully considered.
